level interns to more seasoned group leads   cataloging ,  naming ,  cropping ,  color managing ,  and ,  when necessary ,  performing spot - retouching of a high volume of image assets under tight deadlines   ensuring visual consistency of video and still photography image assets from set to set ,  and day to day   rapidly responding to studio and retail team requests for hard - to - find asset variations and metadata information harvesting  building systems that can scale to those requests without requiring repeated or excessive manual inputs   utilizing appropriate digital asset management techniques to track items between photography bays ,  art directors & creative staff ,  and retouchers worldwide   coordinating with photographers and other digitechs to identify existing process bottlenecks and rapidly deploying scalable improvements   coordinating with software development team to implement continual system innovations   staying current with updates to imaging technology and computing platforms  amazon is an equal opportunity employer  basic qualifications    fluency with capture one ,  photoshop ,  premiere ,  bridge ,  lightroom ,  and ftp clients ,  with an understanding of indesign   basic to intermediate skills in excel ,  word ,  power point ,  and outlook   understanding of color management policies and best practices   minimum of 5 years experience as a digital technician in a commercial photography studio   minimum of 2 years in a team leadership position   demonstrable ability to easily move between mac and pc platforms ,  often networking the two  preferred qualifications    2 year or 4 year degree in photography and / or related field   previous management experience   advanced mac scripting capability   advanced knowledge of networking environments and protocols   a proven ability to juggle multiple projects simultaneously under tight deadlines   excellent verbal ,  written and presentation skills  fashionjobs nycfashion  li -  job description  are you interested in solving unique business problems ,  for a global organization ,  utilizing your creativity ,  business acumen ,  and data analytical skills ?  amazon’s growth requires hr leaders who move fast ,  have an entrepreneurial spirit ,  and an unrelenting tenacity to get things done .  the hr leadership development internship program at amazon is designed to prepare 1st year mba and master’s level candidates for accelerated careers in hr .  as an intern in this program ,  you will have an opportunity to work on challenging projects in support of our real - time business issues ,  all of which are designed to develop skills and experiences within human resources .  over the course of a 12 week internship ,  you will partner closely with business teams ,  senior hr leadership ,  and an hr specialty team to drive projects that develop innovative programs and deliver results in our customer obsessed organization .   sample intern projects     assess amazon’s competitiveness to retain talent with an analytical focus on attrition statistics to identify insightful trends and key drivers   build and execute a framework to measure the impact of amazon’s diversity program on the workforce ,  while developing a methodology for leveraging predictive hr analytics to inform diversity program investments and the impact on hiring and retention at amazon   conduct a competitive analysis and explore existing global programs to identify the available talent pool and develop recruiting models for amazon’s strategic recruiting programs  at amazon ,  we hire individuals who are customer - obsessed ,  self - starters ,  and who have experiences that bring new perspectives to our organization .  we seek to hire the best talent and provide experiences to foster their development into future hr leaders .   basic qualifications    currently enrolled in an mba or master’s program   2+ years of work experience prior to your mba including academic and / or internship experience  preferred qualifications  we are seeking individuals with an mba or master’s level degree in a human resources related discipline with a minimum 2 years of post - bachelor’s degree experience ,  including areas other than hr .  this program is for people who     adapt well to fast - paced environments with high growth ,  ambiguous and changing circumstances   embrace the larger picture and use critical thinking and good judgment while also focusing on details   think strategically as well as roll up their sleeves and do what it takes to “get it done”    are passionate about using data and analytics  are excited about having one of the world’s largest data warehouses at their fingertips   demonstrate a proven ability to manage multiple ,  competing priorities simultaneously   exhibit strong leadership ,  communication and interpersonal skills  if interested in the us or international hrld internship program ,  please visit amazon mba opportunities .  business level fluency in the native language and legal authorization to work in the region / country of application is required .  indicate location preference in cover letter at the time of application .      
 job description  amazon is seeking data - driven ,  business - minded ,  results - oriented financial analyst interns to work in our corporate offices in seattle ,  washington .  amazon is looking for candidates who are bachelor s - degree students in economics ,  finance or information systems with a strong desire to exceed expectations .   typical responsibilities include  · analysis of account balances · preparation and reporting of financial performance for weekly ,  monthly ,  and annual reviews · producing meaningful operational metrics to help drive performance and achieve business objectives .   included as part of the internship is the intern project ,  which requires the candidate to flex their finance ,  accounting ,  analytical ,  and business understanding to work on an optimizing ,  improving ,  and driving quality to solve a problem or improve an existing process .  the intern will interact with various business partners spanning across the operations ,  accounting ,  finance ,  and technology organizations of amazon and will present the result of the project for evaluation at the end of the internship .   dates of finance undergraduate internships  • december to june • april to september • june to december • september to april  basic qualifications  basic requirements  · currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in economics ,  finance ,  information systems ,  accounting or related field .  · available to work a minimum of 40 hours / week during the 6 - month internship  preferred qualifications  the ideal candidate is a proven self - starter with strong analytical skills ,  has an ability to dive deep ,  summarize and communicate important data .  exceptional interpersonal skills ,  persuasive written and oral communication ,  understanding of accounting concepts ,  and a working knowledge of excel are required .  solid organizational and project - management skills are also a must .      
 job description  at amazon ,  we’re trying to make shopping ridiculously great for millions of people .  wanna help ?  we’re looking for interns who are a whole lot of geeks at once .  data geek ?  yep ,  you have to love the numbers ,  words ,  pictures ,  videos and all they add up to .  research geek ?  yep ,  you gotta love figuring out how to answer a question without anybody realizing they were asked anything .  customers geek ?  yep ,  you have to get an uneasy feeling if you haven’t talked to a customer in a while .  ux geek ?  for sure .  you want to be passionate about all the patterns ,  conventions ,  and what they’re all good and terrible at .  what you’ll get we .  move .  fast .  you’ll run too and learn how to do research at a fast pace and see your work make products better out in the world in days and weeks ,  not months and years .  you’ll do whatever research is needed – lab studies ,  card sorting ,  concept testing ,  cog walks ,  field research ,  surveys  -  to make things better and surprise our customers with how good shopping can be .  you’ll also get to work with a pretty unique mix of people – designers ,  prototypers ,  writers ,  developers ,  product managers – people who have been doing this for forever and newcomers like you .  what you’ll do first ,  you’ll assist on a variety of research efforts to learn the ropes .  then ,  we’ll turn you lose to design and run studies and analyze results .  you’ll work with teams to make experiences better .  that’s all standard .  the interesting part is that odds are we’ll launch whatever you work on during your internship and you’ll be able to point to it like “oh ,  no big deal ,  my intern project just getting used by like everybody who shops for stuff online right now . ” and we have internships with various groups at amazon including amazon . com ,  mobile experiences ,  amazonlocal ,  and amazon web services  ( aws )  .   basic qualifications  but it can’t be just anyone you’ll need to interview with our team and we want to see some work samples that you’re proud of  ( stuff from school is fine )  .  required qualifications  · you’ll need to be currently enrolled in a relevant program · you must be available to work full time for 3 months ,  beginning in june .   preferred qualifications  · have already taken hcde 517 usability testing  ( or equivalent )  and at least one research methods course · experience with statistics ,  survey design or prototyping are always a plus .  · experience with software programming or web development will be useful for some of the internships .      
 job description  amazon is looking for smart ,  analytical ,  customer - obsessed ,  and energetic business leaders to help build world - class experiences for our customers and serve as the leadership pipeline for our rapidly growing business .  our unique combinations of cutting - edge technology and customer - focus have enabled amazon to achieve rapid growth in only 15 years ,  and we now serve over 150+ million customers in seven countries across 40 business areas .  if you are looking to become a leader in a global operation ,  enjoy the challenge of driving change and want to be involved in creating the future of online retail ,  and are dynamic ,  organized ,  and a self - starter ,  you may be interested in becoming an operations finance intern .   we move fast and immediately empower our teams to drive meaningful business changes ,  interact with leaders company - wide ,  and make direct contributions to improving the shopping experience for our customers .  from day one ,  you will be given ownership of complex problems and will partner with both finance and operations teams to help a site manage its strategic ,  financial and operational plans .   during your internship in one of our u . s .  fulfillment centers ,  you will report to the controller of the site and work on a real life project and create a business plan with direct impact on our operations business focusing on analyzing opportunities for cost and process improvement which will allow the fulfillment center to work more efficiently and predictably ,  with the highest level of customer satisfaction .  ideal candidates for this position will leverage their strong analytical and communication skills and strategic thinking ability as well as their ability to dive deep into data and provide thought provoking business solutions demonstrating their capability to think big and influence others .  additionally ,  they should have a work ethic based on a strong desire to exceed expectations ,  solid organization and project - management skills ,  good understanding of financial / accounting concepts as well as strong interpersonal ,  written and oral communication skills .   you must be authorized to work in the us without sponsorship .   key responsibilities may include   · providing analytical support for facility optimization initiatives · providing financial analysis to prioritize and lead cost reduction opportunities · analyzing trend patterns within the fulfillment center and working with the site controller and senior financial analyst to help identify and analyze areas for improvement · collecting and analyzing quantitative data from the manufacturing process paths used in measuring site productivity · designing  / maintaining reports based on collected data as well as maintaining / improving metrics models · communicating issues and results to controller and other leadership within the fulfillment center  maintain data integrity  program quick facts  term  10 - week internship benefits  competitive salary ,  relocation and housing assistance locations  amazon’s us fulfillment centers are located nationwide .  for a full list of locations ,  visit www . amazon . com / universityfulfillment .   basic qualifications  · working toward a bachelor’s or master’s degree  ( class of 2014 )  · 1+ years of coursework in finance ,  accounting ,  economics or other related coursework · 1+ years of excel experience  preferred qualifications  · degree in finance ,  accounting ,  economics ,  business or similar field ,  preferred · proficiency of standard software including excel ,  sql ,  oracle and / or other financial systems experience a plus · solid problem solving and root cause analysis experience · excellent oral and written communication skills · strong analytical and business sense · superior attention to detail ,  and the ability to self - start and self - motivate · proven success in an ambiguous environment · demonstrates effective leadership skills and the ability to meet deadlines while managing multiple competing priorities simultaneously and in a fast - paced environment  amazon is an equal opportunity employer  www . amazonfulfillmentcareers . com     
 junior embedded software engineer nashua ,  nh  dell s facility in nashua ,  new hampshire ,  is the home of the award - winning dell equallogic storage area network  ( san )  products ,  which simplify the way businesses of all sizes store and protect information .  now part of a new lineup of dell storage solutions ,  the dell equallogic ps series is the industry s leading family of iscsi - based midrange enterprise disk arrays .  the dell equallogic brand dominates its segment of the san market ,  which is the fastest growing area of the storage industry .  in this dynamic business of helping world - class companies evolve and manage their storage infrastructure ,  our customers represent a   who s who   of global corporations across multiple industries .  they choose to work with us not only for our leading - edge technology that simplifies it ,  but also because of the enormous intellectual capital that is here  -  our exceptional employees .   dell equallogic is seeking software engineers to develop embedded software for its industry leading iscsi virtualized storage devices .  this software implements system management ,  configuration ,  and access control functions  while simultaneously providing ease - of - use that is without parallel in the industry .  this is an opportunity to work for an extraordinarily successful company to develop award - winning products used in cloud computing systems and resource hungry data centers .  you will join a high - caliber team ,  and look forward to the challenge of solving complex and diverse problems .   dell equallogic offers a professional ,  collegial work environment that encourages you to grow and develop in your career .   the ideal candidate has the following technical qualifications   ·         at least 2 years of experience ·         strong background with c ,  c++ ,  or java ·         object oriented skills ·         experience with a variant of unix ·         experience with debug tools ·         experience working in a team environment ·         ability to share your ideas and influence ·         ability to quickly ramp up on new technology  life at dell  equal employment opportunity policy  job requisition number  130010vy     
 intern supply chain development program austin ,  tx  want to join a world - class global supply chain organization where you can drive change while building a long - term career ?  dell’s supply chain organization offers the opportunity to learn industry leading skills through our in - house training programs and top of the line career development courses .  dell has been held as the “golden example” of supply chain management ,  as a member of the supply chain team you will have an opportunity to support dell’s transformation strategy ,  develop your career ,  and partner with a diverse team of talented supply chain experts .   dell ,  inc .  is looking for undergraduate interns to join dell’s supply chain development program  ( scdp )  ,  a global three year rotational program aimed at developing dell’s future supply chain leadership .  the program combines three ,  one year rotations with coursework to provide participants with a wide breadth of experiences and an advanced knowledge of dell’s supply chain .  in addition ,  the program offers visibility / networking with managers and executives ,  career development planning ,  soft skill training ,  developmental workshops ,  and a robust feedback / performance review process .   the coursework is conducted both in classroom and virtual settings .  courses are taught by subject matter experts within dell’s supply chain leadership .   the one year rotations place participants in fulfillment and logistics ,  procurement ,  and supply chain operations positions across the organization .  example roles and experiences include   -  client demand / supply planning  -  enterprise demand / supply planning  -  finished goods replenishment planning  -  factory operations  -  global sales operations  -  global operations engineering  -  global process & quality standards  -  fulfillment operations  -  global inventory control & transformation  -  global materials  -  commodity management  -  supply chain design  -  supply chain enablement international assignments are possibilities for top performers – the assignments are heavily dependent on prior program performance and current business needs .   ideal candidates will have   -  clear and effective communication  -  dealing with ambiguity  -  flexibility  /  adaptability to a changing environment  company description with more than 100 , 000 team members globally ,  we promote an environment that is rooted in the entrepreneurial spirit in which the company was founded .  dell’s team members are committed to serving our communities ,  regularly volunteering for over 1 , 500 non - profit organizations .  the company has also received many accolades from employer of choice to energy conservation .  our team members follow an open approach to technology innovation and believe that technology is essential for human success .  why work with us ?  life at dell means collaborating with dedicated professionals with a passion for technology .  when we see something that could be improved ,  we get to work inventing the solution .  our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships .  we invest in our people and offer a series of programs that enables them to pursue a career that fulfills their potential .  our team members’ health and wellness is our priority as well as rewarding them for their hard work   li -  medical assistant associate dearborn ,  mi  dell inc .  is a global provider of healthcare services and information technology solutions to a broad range of clients .  we are currently looking for a full - time medical assistant to join our team at our urgent care facilities in garden city ,  southgate ,  and wyandotte .   as a medical assistant ,  you will work under the supervision of a licensed provider / nurse ,  and in accordance with established policy and procedures ,  performs a wide range of direct and indirect patient care activities .  a medical assistant is responsible for clinical duties ,  regulatory agency compliance ,  collecting patient history ,  and effectively relaying instructions from physician to patients / families .   job description / responsibilities    -   knowledge gained through job experience to resolve more complex issues and coordinate day - to - day work   -  will not normally need instructions / guidance on routine work  typically self - initiates task priority within established guidelines   -  independently gathers information and resources needed to complete tasks / projects   -  may provide guidance to others when appropriate   -   experience and judgment to make decisions or resolve issues within standard guidelines and protocols   -  has a strong understanding of processes and procedures ,  and a knowledge of related regulations and standards   -  may assist with onboarding and training new team members  acts as a mentor to motivate and support staff in performing daily duties   -  daily decisions and actions demonstrate a high level of engagement and sense of job ownership regarding desired business outcomes – high patient satisfaction and safety ,  optimal productivity ,  and high employee morale   -  consistently demonstrate competency in job required skills   -  attend mandatory training programs   -  verbalize knowledge of ,  and participate in ,  emergency management exercises   -  ensure functionality and maintenance of medical equipment   -  participate in maintaining continuous accreditation readiness   -  assist patients as needed with walking ,  transfers ,  dressing ,  collecting specimens ,  and preparing for exam   -  perform business office functions  ( clerical ,  environmental ,  and organizational )  under the supervision of the practice manager or supervisor   -  perform routine clinical functions under the supervision of a licensed provider / nurse   -  clinical duties can include but are not limited to  completion of a pain screening ,  record height ,  weight ,  and vital signs ,  explain procedures to patients ,  collect and prepare laboratory specimens ,  perform basic laboratory tests on the premises ,  sterilize medical instruments ,  promote patient / family understanding of the educational content and his / her involvement in the plan of care ,  prepare and administer medications as directed by physician ,  authorize drug refills as directed by the physician ,  telephone prescriptions to a pharmacy ,  draw blood ,  prepare patients for x - rays ,  take electrocardiograms ,  remove sutures / staples ,  change sterile and non - sterile dressings ,  and other duties as assigned  qualifications / requirements    -  must have 3  -  10 years of work experience as a medical assistant   -  high school graduate or ged equivalent   -  documented proof of medical assistant program completion is required ,  certification with the aama or amt is preferred  ( cma / rma )    -  current bls certification through the american heart association ,  or within 60 days of date of hire   -  must be willing to work days ,  evenings ,  and / or weekends   -  must have excellent written and verbal communication skills   -  must be able to multi - task   -  must be able to work collaboratively and seamlessly with all dell and oakwood personnel alike   -  must be able to lift up to 30 pounds of supplies   -  must be willing to work a variety of hours including evenings ,  weekends ,  and / or holidays   -  must be willing to travel between all opi healthcare centers as required / requested  with more than 100 , 000 team members globally ,  we promote an environment that is rooted in the entrepreneurial spirit in which the company was founded .  dell’s team members are committed to serving our communities ,  regularly volunteering for over 1 , 500 non - profit organizations .  the company has also received many accolades from employer of choice to energy conservation .  our team members follow an open approach to technology innovation and believe that technology is essential for human success .   why work with us ?    -  life at dell means collaborating with dedicated professionals with a passion for technology .    -  when we see something that could be improved ,  we get to work inventing the solution .    -  our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships .    -  we invest in our people and offer a series of programs that enables them to pursue a career that fulfills their potential .    -  our team members’ health and wellness is our priority as well as rewarding them for their hard work .   dell is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind  dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment .  all employment decisions at dell are based on business needs ,  job requirements and individual qualifications ,  without regard to race ,  color ,  religion or belief ,  national ,  social or ethnic origin ,  sex ,  age ,  physical ,  mental or sensory disability ,  hiv status ,  sexual orientation ,  gender identity and / or expression ,  marital ,  civil union or domestic partnership status ,  past or present military service ,  family medical history or genetic information ,  family or parental status  ( including pregnancy )  ,  or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate .  dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics .   life at dell  equal employment opportunity policy  job requisition number  130011p3

 junior storage management engineer nashua ,  nh  dell s facility in nashua ,  new hampshire ,  is the home of the award - winning dell equallogic storage area network  ( san )  products ,  which simplify the way businesses of all sizes store and protect information .  now part of a new lineup of dell storage solutions ,  the dell equallogic ps series is the industry s leading family of iscsi - based midrange enterprise disk arrays .  the dell equallogic brand dominates its segment of the san market ,  which is the fastest growing area of the storage industry .  in this dynamic business of helping world - class companies evolve and manage their storage infrastructure ,  our customers represent a   who s who   of global corporations across multiple industries .  they choose to work with us not only for our leading - edge technology that simplifies it ,  but also because of the enormous intellectual capital that is here  -  our exceptional employees .   our dell storage virtualization team creates tools that integrate our storage solutions with vmware products by finding useful ways to provide simplified ,  yet full featured ,  extensions to their products ,  while maximizing the features and workflow automation of ours .   we are looking for an enthusiastic software development engineer to work on our j2ee based middleware management server .  primary responsibilities ·         design ,  develop and execute automated management features and workflows ·         create unit level verification tests ·         work with software developers and qa engineers to troubleshoot and triage issues and defects ·         communicate status effectively and ensure high quality deliverables .   the ideal candidate has the following technical qualifications   -  ·         2 - 5 years of professional experience  -  ·         independent ,  hardworking ,  creative ,  focused ,  organized ,  strong team player  -  ·         excellent verbal and written communication skills  -  ·         must be customer and product focused ,  willing to adapt to changing needs ,  and produce tangible results  -  ·         good analytical skills with attention to detail .   -  ·         good understanding of java and j2ee is a must .   -  title  junior embedded software engineer location  nh - nashua dell  s facility in nashua ,  new hampshire ,  is the home of the award - winning dell equallogic storage area network  ( san )  products ,  which simplify the way businesses of all sizes store and protect information .  now part of a new lineup of dell storage solutions ,  the dell equallogic ps series is the industry  s leading family of iscsi - based midrange enterprise disk arrays .  the dell equallogic brand dominates its segment of the san market ,  which is the fastest growing area of the storage industry .  in this dynamic business of helping world - class companies evolve and manage their storage infrastructure ,  our customers represent a   who  s who   of global corporations across multiple industries .  they choose to work with us not only for our leading - edge technology that simplifies it ,  but also because of the enormous intellectual capital that is here  -  our exceptional employees .  dell equallogic is seeking software engineers to develop embedded software for its industry leading iscsi virtualized storage devices .  this software implements system management ,  configuration ,  and access control functions  while simultaneously providing ease - of - use that is without parallel in the industry .  this is an opportunity to work for an extraordinarily successful company to develop award - winning products used in cloud computing systems and resource hungry data centers .  you will join a high -  hewlett - packard laboratories  ( hpl )  is an international research organization with its headquarters and largest facility located in palo alto ,  ca .  as hp s central research organization ,  hp labs  purpose is to deliver breakthrough technologies and technology advancements that provide a competitive advantage for hp ,  by investing in fundamental science and technology in areas of interest to hp .  our research is focused in the following areas  next - generation adaptive computing ,  printing and imaging ,  technologies for services ,  consumer systems ,  and emerging and disruptive technologies .       the printing and content delivery lab of hp labs is seeking a researcher to conduct research in automated document composition technologies applied to multi - channel digital publishing .   the research will include building document composition systems for real world automated content delivery .  the candidate will also be expected to lead the prototyping of document composition algorithms in an efficient manner taking full advantage of cloud / client side computing resources .   hp labs researchers are expected to undertake research programs which will advance the state of the art and have a significant business impact for hp .   the ideal candidate will possess a strong publication record at top tier conferences and journals .   at the same time ,  the candidate will be able to collaborate with other researchers ,  software developers ,  marketing strategists ,  and product managers on new applications and systems .   strong communication skills are required ,  and the ability to drive research results into products is highly valued .  applicants should possess in - depth knowledge of current technologies and research literature ,  and candidates with skills and experience in software development are preferred .   qualifications       the successful candidate should possess a ph . d .  degree in computer science or related discipline .   he or she is expected to have a strong background in document workflow automation ,  and / or document composition with an established research record .   key characteristics of the successful candidate include   ph . d .  with document engineering focus    expertise with publishing / rendering systems  ( tex / scribus api / indesign api / html5 / css3 )  is a strong plus    prior experience working with probabilistic / statistical models is a plus    overall strong implementation skills .  proficiency using matlab and java is a plus .     knowledge of parallel processing frameworks  ( hadoop )  is a plus  applicants should also have several of the following qualifications     ability to develop and execute a research plan    strong publication record    in - depth knowledge of current research    passion for incorporating research results into products    excellent written and verbal communication skill

 about us  a great opportunity to join the hp hotel management family .  hp hotel management is a growing national hotel development and management company .  situated in oklahoma city in the quail springs area ,  the hilton garden inn oklahoma city north quail springs offers comfort and convenience .  we are currently seeking highly motivated individuals to join our team as front desk associates .  front desk associates are responsible for assisting guests and performing all front desk duties .  front desk associates report directly to the front desk manager .  responsibilities  greet all customers who approach the front desk in a smiling ,  friendly manner .  check - in arriving guests in the most efficient manner possible ,  following all established procedures and policies .  check - out departing guests in the most efficient manner possible ,  following all established procedures and policies .  review arriving reservations for the day early in the shift ,  checking for special requests ,  vip s ,  etc .  ,  preassigning rooms as necessary .  pre - register groups that have requested pre - registration .  count cash drawer at beginning and end of each shift .  prepare shift deposit accurately ,  following standard procedures .  record messages and receive mail for arriving and in - house guests .  ensure that message lights are turned on and off as necessary .  check all guest folios during each shift ,  checking for potential credit problems .  ensure that all guests have either sufficient cash balances or authorized credit cards to cover expected charges .  take steps to notify cash customers who have used their credit balances to come and pay on their account .  record future reservations for any guest by phone or in person ,  following all standard procedures .  always check for sold - out dates before promising availability .  handle complaints efficiently and courteously .  other duties as assigned .  requirements  high school diploma .  standing and walking 100% of the time with lifting and bending .  the ability to see and hear .  fluent in english .  computer literate .

leading organization and get engaged in the full lifecycle development of business applications and / or information systems solutions for internal hp customers .  you will have the opportunity to work with a global engineering team on analysis of business requirements ,  coding of modifications or new programs ,  creation of documentation ,  testing and maintenance of applications ,  infrastructure ,  and information systems including database management systems .  aligning with hp  s technical career path ,  hp offers you both vertical and horizontal growth in engineering ,  it and services .  qualifications  key responsibilities  required    must be currently pursuing a bachelor  s ,  master  s or phd degree in computer science ,  software engineering ,  computer engineering ,  information systems ,  industrial engineering ,  or related fields .    software programming knowledge of and / or experience with one or more of the following  independent code line over 20 , 000 ,  java ,  java script ,  c ,  c  ,  c# ,  vb . net   application development knowledge of and / or experience with databases such as sql server ,  oracle ,  mysql ,  and experience with linux shell script and windows programming   test engineering knowledge of and / or experience with qtp and / or loadrunner testing tools   ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions   passion for technology   eager ,  quick learner with strong team - work spirit   excellent oral and written english communication skills desired    prior internship experience   leadership experience at university   basic knowledge of mobile device development ,  application solution delivery ,  erp  ( such as sap )  ,  business intelligence and testing service solutions   basic knowledge of web development tools   familiar with cloud application deployment methods   able to perform in a fast - paced ,  demanding environment   supply chain knowledge job  information technology

  as an entry - level business analytics consultant ,  you will use your analytical and technical skills to help our clients turn information into intelligence that enables smarter ,  collaborative ,  fact - based decisions ,  improves productivity and efficiency ,  and drives results .  you will also have the opportunity to join consulting by degrees — our world - class leadership and development program designed to provide the full - spectrum of structured training ,  development ,  and practical experience necessary to successfully launch and accelerate your career .  you will contribute right away to top - tier clients in collaboration with smart people in a dynamic team environment .  you will work on projects that help clients integrate strategy ,  process ,  technology ,  and information to increase effectiveness ,  reduce costs ,  promote accountability ,  and optimize performance .  you will have an opportunity to build a powerful portfolio of interesting and rewarding experiences .  you can take advantage of opportunities to master new skills ,  work across different disciplines and move into new challenges .  you can do all of this at ibm  -  -  a company that is at the forefront of tackling the grand challenges that affect our society ,  such as climate change ,  energy production ,  traffic congestion and health care .   what do we look for in a successful entry - level business analytics consultant ?  this role performs varying degrees of problem determination and resolution of desktop hardware and software problems through the effective use of available technical resources ,  per contracted service level agreements .  they may also perform installs ,  moves ,  adds and change  ( imac )  activities ,  as well as data backup and restore on certain accounts ,  for clients .  they are responsible for resolving problems and performing imacs within service level agreement objectives  ( sla )  ,  and completing all related administrative duties .  as the main interface to the client ,  they need to understand the local and regional infrastructure and key contacts in the other competencies ,  i . e .  network team ,  server admin ,  etc .  ,  in order to ensure that the proper team is aware of ,  and taking action on the problem .  strong client communication and business skills are therefore needed since direct client interaction is often required .  accordingly ,  they have a direct impact on client satisfaction ,  and therefore ,  need to understand their account / site environment .  responsibilities include  resolve client hardware / software pc problem tickets .  a technical knowledge of the supported platform is required as well as a working knowledge of the hardware .  resolve tickets within the client sla and obtain a high client satisfaction rating .  good communication skills are required .   required   high school diploma / ged   at least 6 months experience in software and hardware skills ,  deskside support   u . s .  citizenship required   english  basic knowledge  ibm is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer .  all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race ,  color ,  religion ,  gender ,  gender identity or expression ,  sexual orientation ,  national origin ,  genetics ,  disability ,  age ,  or veteran status .

 trusteer ,  an ibm company ,  is the global leader in endpoint cybercrime prevention .  trusteer products stop the root cause of data breaches and fraud losses  the compromise of employee and customer endpoints by advanced malware and phishing attacks .   as a security software sales representative ,  you are responsible for developing solutions address the client s business needs and deliver client value .  you will be responsible for opportunity identification ,  forecasting ,  sales execution and customer satisfaction .  you will work to create solutions which are tailored to client’s business needs and integrate the ibm capabilities in a way that is valued by the customer and superior to the competition .  you are also responsible for developing and maintaining strong relationships with executives and influencers in the it and line - of - business organizations in these accounts .  you will navigate ibm to identify and acquire critical resources needed to develop the best solution for the client ,  while applying ibm brand strategies and offerings ,  methods and models ,  to ensure world - class design and delivery .   further responsibilities   - target the largest financial institutions in your territory and develop extensive knowledge of these accounts – key contacts ,  business needs ,  existing fraud prevention tools ,  competitive environment ,  gaps and requirements ,  budgeting and buying processes .   - introduce trusteer solutions to key buyers / influencers and establish trusted relationships .   - manage complex sales process ,  from initial meeting through procurement and contract signing .   - explain ibm / trusteer value proposition through presentation ,  email ,  and verbal communications .   - be fluent in core ibm solution capabilities and competitive environment .   - track and report on all activities though the sales automation system .   - manage pipeline and provide reliable forecast .   key attributes   - trusted relationships with line of business ,  online / mobile banking ,  and information security executives .   - self - driven ,  energetic ,  creative problem - solver ,  with a   hunter   mentality ,  able to prospect new opportunities ,  with a natural nurturing instinct ,  able to build trusted ,  long - lasting customer relationships .   - strong prospecting ,  qualifying ,  closing and managing skills .   - impressive presentation and communication skills with the ability to influence ,  persuade ,  and negotiate at all levels to achieve win - win situations .   - experience selling within matrix environments .   required   at least 3 years experience in software sales ,  tech sales or pre - sales   at least 3 years experience in and executive relationships in one or more financial segments  retail and business banking ,  private wealth management ,  investment banking ,  brokerage ,  processor / merchant acquirer .    at least 2 years experience in selling complex solutions to information security officers ,  online and mobile banking application owners ,  and line of business leaders   readiness to travel 25% travel annually   english  fluent  preferred   bachelor s degree   at least 3 years experience in fraud solution sales  ibm is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer .  all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race ,  color ,  religion ,  gender ,  gender identity or expression ,  sexual orientation ,  national origin ,  genetics ,  disability ,  age ,  or veteran status .       preferred   bachelor s degree   at least 3 years experience in fraud solution sales

 ibm / tealeaf is a recognized leader in customer experience management with world - class clients that read as a who s - who of internet commerce in financial services ,  retail ,  manufacturing and travel .  tealeaf cx solutions enable companies to ensure the success of their customer’s web or mobile interactions ,  which is enabled by tealeaf’s unmatched visibility into the real - time customer experience .   exciting sales opportunity responsible for developing tealeaf specific solutions that address client’s business needs  ( both industry and business )  and deliver client value while supporting brand - specific business strategies .  you will work to create solutions which are tailored to client’s business needs and integrate the ibm / tealeaf capabilities in a way that is valued by the customer and superior to the competition .  in this role ,  it is essential that you are able to apply industry - specific knowledge and experience to bring new business and technology insights to assigned clients .   key responsibilities  • achieve / exceed quarterly and annual revenue quotas on a consistent basis  implement sales / marketing tactics and programs in order to meet or exceed assigned territory objectives .  • identify and effectively qualify sales leads  maintain a sales revenue pipeline equivalent to at least 3 times quota as measured via salesforce . com .  • develop and execute on sales / business plans to achieve quarterly sales / business objectives  provide accurate and timely reports / forecasts .  • develop business solutions that solve customer application integrity problems through the use of tealeaf s patented software .  • identify and qualify prospective customers and penetrate targeted prospects in assigned geographical territory .  • develop a team selling approach and act as a liaison between tealeaf s customers and pre - sales technical specialists ,  inside sales and the customer service organization .  • develop and implement a regional sales plan in conjunction with tealeaf s solution selling methodology .  • manage prospect and customer accounts to achieve expedient purchase decisions .  • track all sales activity through the sales automation system .   key attributes  • solid business acumen / ability to position solution roi • ability to build consistent new revenue pipeline • self starter • commitment to stay current with industry / sector trends • ability to articulate ,  define and execute creative strategies to grow the tealeaf business and reach new markets • ability to interface within a multi - brand sales organization • executive level sales • an outstanding ability to understand business problems ,  position and articulate a vision with a corresponding solution to improve customer’s business processes and performance .   required   at least 3 years experience in enterprise software sales   at least 2 years experience in business intelligence ,  content management ,  customer relationship management or other web application   at least 2 years experience in consultative selling and account and customer relationship development at senior levels   readiness to travel 10% travel annually   english  fluent  preferred   bachelor s degree   at least 5 years experience in customer experience management   at least 3 years experience in managing complex sales processes with a mix of transactional and strategic opportunities   at least 1 year experience in one or more of the following industries financial services ,  retail ,  manufacturing or travel  additional information candidates should reside in san francisco ,  oakland or san jose ,  ca  ibm is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer .  all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race ,  color ,  religion ,  gender ,  gender identity or expression ,  sexual orientation ,  national origin ,  genetics ,  disability ,  age ,  or veteran status .       preferred   bachelor s degree   at least 5 years experience in customer experience management   at least 3 years experience in managing complex sales processes with a mix of transactional and strategic opportunities   at least 1 year experience in one or more of the following industries financial services ,  retail ,  manufacturing or travel   additional information candidates should reside in san francisco ,  oakland or san jose ,  ca      additional information candidates should reside in san francisco ,  oakland or san jose ,  ca     
 join a leader .  consult with us .  help build a smarter planet along the way .   at ibm global business services public sector ,  we serve government ,  healthcare ,  education ,  and state and local clients through our application innovation services  ( application development / design & systems integration )  ,  business analytics & optimization ,  finance & risk ,  strategy & innovation ,  supply chain management ,  organization & people ,  and enterprise applications  ( sap & oracle )  service lines .  through cutting edge service offerings ,  we deliver real business value by     bringing together the world’s largest consulting practice with industry - leading research capability .     enriching business and government consulting with advanced research ,  analytics and technology .     establishing new ,  flexible and iterative approaches that only ibm can offer through our unique combination of skills ,  experience and capabilities .     leveraging proven roadmaps and frameworks we have developed across our 17 industries .     applying ibm s global expertise and local capabilities through our unique global delivery network combined with our teams in over 170 countries .     providing an integrated approach to business design and execution—turning strategies into actions .   these strengths ,  applied to government ,  healthcare ,  and education issues and opportunities ,  give our clients not only the ability to anticipate change ,  but also to take advantage of new possibilities .   what will you do as an entry - level it specialist consultant ?  join a leader .  consult with us .  help build a smarter planet along the way .   everyday ,  the world becomes exponentially more interconnected ,  digitized and data - aware .  the world is getting smarter ,  triggering unprecedented change .  yesterday’s business models no longer equip organizations to capitalize on this change .   at ibm global business services we partner with our clients to deliver real business value by…  • bringing together the world’s largest consulting practice with industry -  leading research capability .  • enriching business consulting with advanced research ,  analytics and technology .  • teaming on all phases of engagement to plan ,  build ,  and implement advanced business solutions .  • establishing new ,  flexible and iterative approaches that only ibm can offer through our unique combination of skills ,  experience and capabilities .  • leveraging the proven roadmaps and frameworks we have developed across our 17 industries .  • applying ibm s global expertise and local capabilities through our unique global delivery network combined with our teams in over 170 countries .    providing our clients with an integrated approach to business design and execution ,  turning strategies into actions .   what will you do as an ibm gbs consultant ?  as an entry level consultant ,  you will have the opportunity to join consulting by degrees — our world - class leadership and development program designed to provide the full - spectrum of structured training ,  development ,  and practical experience necessary to successfully launch and accelerate your career .  you will contribute right away to top - tier clients in collaboration with smart people in a dynamic team environment .  you will work on projects that help clients integrate strategy ,  process ,  technology and information to increase effectiveness ,  reduce costs and improve profit and shareholder value .  you will have an opportunity to build a powerful portfolio of interesting and rewarding experiences .  you can take advantage of opportunities to master new skills ,  work across different disciplines and move into new challenges .   all at ibm ,  a company that is at the forefront of tackling the grand challenges that affect our society ,  such as climate change ,  energy production ,  traffic congestion and health care .   come see why others have felt that no other entry - level opportunity gives such exposure in the business world .  are you an ibmer ?   what do we look for in a successful consultant at ibm ?  • strong leadership and adaptability ,  with willingness to readily and voluntarily take ownership of highly challenging tasks and problems ,  even beyond initial scope of responsibility • thorough and analytical ,  with capability to apply logic to solve problems • ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently and meet deadlines ,  while maintaining focus despite conflicting demands • drive to overcome the most challenging or difficult obstacles and look for ways to improve results • initiative to actively seek new knowledge and improve skills • effective interpersonal skills with ability to collaborate and work effectively with individuals ,  strengthening relationships to achieve win - win solutions • ability to communicate complex situations clearly and simply by listening actively and conveying difficult messages in a positive manner • a passion for innovative ideas ,  coupled with the ability to understand and assimilate different points of view  basic / required qualifications   • high school diploma • willingness and ability to travel up to 4 days a week  ( home on weekends – based on project requirements )  • reside within a reasonable commuting distance  ( generally 50 miles or less )  of one of the following cities  atlanta  ( ga )  ,  boston  ( ma )  ,  chicago  ( il )  ,  columbus  ( oh )  ,  houston  ( tx )  ,  new york  ( ny )  and metro area ,  philadelphia  ( pa )  ,  washington  ( dc )  and metro area .  limited opportunities are available in san francisco  ( ca )  .   .  ibm’s systems and technology group is looking for entry level engineers to join its semiconductor client solutions organization .  this organization is responsible for support of ibm s us 200 & 300mm wafer fabrication facilities in the areas of world wide test development ,  integrated supply chain and microelectronics client quality solutions .  this specific job requisition is for a test engineer in support of world wide test development and operations .  the test engineer candidate will develop ,  verify functionality and implement new verification  ( test )  programs and / or support test hardware development solutions ,  for ibm s latest technologies at wafer and package level test .  candidate will work with team members in support of current and new test solution development and implementation and ongoing improvements in support of lean manufacturing .     available positions  test equipment and test analysis / characterization engineers    disciplines  electrical engineering ,  computer engineering ,  mechanical engineering ,  microelectronics engineering ,  or a related field with skills in the semiconductor processing ,  product / circuit design ,  test ,  characterization and / or device design .     positions may be available in essex junction ,  vermont and hopewell junction ,  new york  ibm systems and technology group has opportunities for technical solutions engineers to manage and support our oem custom logic / specialty foundry customers .  we develop industry - leading custom silicon solutions for many brand - name wireless ,  networking ,  storage and consumer products .  custom logic / specialty foundry technical solution engineers have responsibility for the sale and support of these solutions and for management of the client relationship ,  including technical sales support which may include  collaboration within the ibm sales and brand teams to define ,  design ,  and detail the technical aspects and feasibility of ibm semiconductor solutions  team -  the system engineer works with project system engineer ,  customer personnel ,  project architects ,  and project managers to identify functional requirements and subsequently manages the team across the identification ,  justification and design activities for the customer s solution .   as an individual contributor or member of a team ,  performs a technical role in support of technical solutions ,  from requirement gathering and analysis through solution development ,  test and deployment .  this includes translating the customerÂ’s business requirements into specific system ,  application or process designs for large ,  complex or leading edge solutions .   the system engineer assists in delivery of high quality solutions to clients in response to specific business requirements ,  develops technical skills and absorbs professional knowledge quickly ,  performs assigned technical tasks including study ,  analysis ,  programming ,  product installation .  the engagements .  may use tools to analyze and implement portions of a customer solution .   required   high school diploma / ged   basic knowledge in technical skills in any of the following  ready to change the way the world works ?  this is your chance to develop and work with innovative new technology products ,  as well as your career ,  with the world s second largest software - maker  ibm .  hone your expertise alongside fellow talented professionals ,  where you ll develop and / or test some of the most exciting software solutions on the market .   we are looking for two  ( 2 )  enthusiastic software test specialist coop students who are interested to join the qa  ( quality assurance )   -  functional verification test  ( fvt )  software engineering teams in san jose ,  california or costa mesa ,  california for up to a an 12 - month internship .  the ideal coop student will bring passion ,  initiative ,  excellent communication skills ,  and a “take charge” attitude working with the information lifecycle governance development ,  quality assurance ,  support and test teams ,  and will have the unique opportunity to learn and apply the concepts of defensible disposal solutions ,  the atlas product suite ,  ediscovery ,  and enterprise records  ( ier )     -  ibm atlas is a standard for legal holds and retention management software ,  which enables customers to more effectively retain and archive information ,  efficiently meet ediscovery obligations ,  and defensibly dispose of information .    -  ibm enterprise records  ( ier )  provides the record management solution for enterprise content management systems .  this application is responsible for the retention and disposal of documents and other content in accordance to government rules and standards .    -  ibm ediscovery manager assists with legal discovery and helps you handle immediate litigation and investigation matters by enabling you to proactively search ,  manage ,  and export electronically stored information  ( esi )  ,  including email and other business content .   all three product areas provide for unique customer solutions where the coop student will be exposed to the complete lifecycle of software product development ,  from initial requirements gathering ,  to elaboration and design ,  testing ,  and final delivery .   this position provides the coop student with a great opportunity to work in a global team ,  and learn and use several development and test tools ,  such as selenium ,  rational team concert  ( rtc )  ,  rational appscan ,  rational quality manager  ( rqm )  ,  and rational application developer  ( rad )  .  the project may also include the development of automated test cases using selenium .   interested in learning more about ibm ?  check out the ibm global careers newsletter .   note that this job requisition is for an internship role  therefore ,  only currently enrolled students  ( bachelor s or master s degree )  are eligible to apply for this position .   required   high school diploma / ged   basic knowledge in java development  ( java ,  javascript ,  j2ee )    basic knowledge in function testing  as a performance engineer summer intern at data . com you will get hands on experience with services that scale to millions of users with even greater number of transactions per day .  you will be part of the performance engineering team that is responsible to ensure that our web and cloud based services and platforms have high performance ,  response time and availability as well as are scalable to our ever growing number of users .  you will be expected to apply your skills around system performance management by running complex simulations to validate factors such as cpu speed ,  memory and disk io .  you will also have to work closely with your technical operations team to evaluate and benchmark production performance and participate in troubleshooting of performance related issues in production systems .  responsibilities  be part of a fast paced performance engineering team working with several functional teams to help validate new products and features against production performance standards participate in the development of tools and processes  ( monitoring ,  measurement ,  load generation etc .  )  that will enable us to continuously run performance workloads and catch issues early and often develop well - tuned code that will provide effective and efficient testing and monitoring of our scalable world class service own a performance engineering project over the course of the internship that will in some manner contribute towards ensuring that we are meeting our performance goals standards and delivering beyond our customer expectations experience / skills required  enrolled in junior year or higher at a college / university or any year at a graduate school working towards a bs or ms in computer science ,  electrical engineering or related field hands - c ,  java or standard c 99 is a plus .   working knowledge of other programming languages ,  such as c++ ,   c# .   experience with javascript ,  html5 technologies a plus .   proficiency in software development design patterns and methodologies .   proficiency with testing methodologies and technologies such as tdd ,  bdd ,  mocks ,  stubs .   experience with multi -  job titleinternal sales representative isr  - alpharetta ,  gadealer funding ,  llc is a sub - prime auto finance company headquartered in alpharetta ,  ga .  dealer funding purchases retail installment contracts from its franchise and independent automobile dealer network in georgia ,  south carolina ,  tennessee ,  mississippi ,  alabama ,  kentucky ,  and florida .  the company has successfully been in business for over 15 years and is currently hiring for an internal sales representative . internal sales representative positionthe internal sales representative will be responsible for lead generation and to identify and solicit prospective franchise and independent dealers .  this will be accomplished by making a minimum of 25 - targeted telephone calls / day .  the isr will be aligned with an outside dealer representative who will work with them to grow sales through outbound selling when needed .  it will be the responsibility of the isr to prospect and data mine in order to grow the business .  this position will work with an outside dealer representative and sales manager when necessary to transition accounts to / from inside sales to outside sales .  this position has a focus on customer service and to carry out dealer funding s brand .  this position carries a direct sales quota and is eligible for variable compensation tied to a performance goal .  responsibilitiesdirect contact using outbound calling strategy . maintaining and updating prospects within the sales nexus system . establishing initial contacts with decision makers at prospects . follow up on approved and non - funded deals . manage dealer relationships to achieve quality and volume objectives . identify and solicit prospective dealers . manage assigned accounts by handling account inquiries to minimize account attrition and negative volume variance .  assist field sales staff in increasing prospective dealers by prospecting new business opportunities and evaluating potential growth of existing clients .  identify and solicit prospective dealers . other dutieswork as a team member to achieve the organizations goals .  other duties as assigned . qualificationscomplete understanding of dealer funding s underwriting policies and procedures . previous automobile finance company marketing experience is beneficial . a thorough understanding of dealership operations and the auto finance industry . skillsstrong sales and people skills . self - motivated and able to work independently . excellent verbal and writing skills . able to travel . able to meet deadlines and established goals and objectives . must be proficient in computer software such as excel ,  word ,  powerpoint ,  salesnexus  ( or other contact management software )  outlook .

 sap .  the internship will teach and enhance requirement gathering skills with our business associates and provide development solutions for real business problems .  the position will work in the global information services division as a part of the business systems development team and report to the development manager .   candidate will be part of a team composed of both functional and development analysts responsible for gathering business requirements and developing data warehouse reporting solutions using sap standard development tools .  the opportunity provides the ability to learn sap’s business intelligence architecture ,  modeling concepts ,  and report design .  the ideal candidate needs to have the desire to learn ,  understand ,  and document business processes as well as provide technical development solutions to support process improvements .   technical skills required   · working knowledge of microsoft office applications  · advanced skills in microsoft excel a plus  · programming and software development skills  · working knowledge of microsoft outlook or equivalent email and calendar software  related course work in the following   · business finance and / or business operations  · software development lifecycle  · data modeling  · introduction / advanced course in programming development  · integration of systems and business  · technical writing  · data analysis and data mining  · junior or senior status

 job description although this internship will be a learning experience ,  we expect students who apply to have some degree of business experience ,  along with being extremely tech - savvy .  what do it pros data analysts do here ?  research .  we love it !  can t get enough of it !  finding information on the web is one of the key factors of success here .  in this case ,  we research ,  gather and upload employer and technologists data within the philadelphia region .  our end goal is to have over 120 , 000 technologists and 15 , 000+ employers properly uploaded .  upload .  once we collect this data ,  we upload it into our web / mobile - based database and ensure proper data accuracy ,  quality and integrity and then assign it to the proper team member for a call to action .  cross - reference .  all technologist data is cross - referenced to their most recent employer for further increase revenue generating initiatives .  data mine .  as requests come in from team members and employers ,  it s important to be able to easily mine and present compatible data .  this is done through a filter and tags within our database .  outperform .  we look to crush our competitors .  we look to exceed expectations every time .  we lead ,  others follow .  where do we work ?  remote  .  we have an asynchronous culture that is well suited to remote - working .  we use google+ hangout ,  gchat and asana to communicate internally .  all team members work remotely and live within the greater philadelphia region ,  outside of one who recently moved from philly to connecticut .  local .  for when we want to get out of the house ,  we have an awesome conference center located in northern liberties that offers a front deskconcierge ,  snacks and wi - fi .  yard s brewery ,  morgan s pier ,  north bowl and the piazza at schmidts are all a short walk away .  how do we earn ?  profit sharing  .  all team members earn their keep by producing results  ( period )  .  we earn based on successful transactions between us staffing a technologist with an employer .  commissions are based on a percentage of total revenue received payed upon receipt .  invoices are due within 30 - days of the candidate start date with a quick payment option discount is available if paid within 5 - days .  bonuses .  we believe in rewarding great accomplishments .  varying forms of bonuses are delivered on a monthly basis .  what perks do we offer ?  flexible work schedule .  we are all free to choose our own schedule .  free to choose our own schedule .  if we feel extra charged ,  we work as long as we want to .  if we re having a down day ,  we take it easy .  we re all about producing the best quality work when we can ,  which is more times than not .  vacation policy  .  there is none .  we believe in taking time off to recharge .  whatever is needed to make it happen upon return .  company sponsored events .  we believe in team building outside of the workplace .  it only makes us stronger .  if you re into going to places like yard s brewery ,  north bowl ,  sporting events ,  etc .  then you ll fit right in .  qualifications we are very particular with the types of folks we bring aboard to join our team .  those who can help us take it pros to the next level will be considered and in return will be rewarded handsomely .  what do you absolutely need to have ?  must be currently pursuing a degree in technology or a related field of study must be local to the philadelphia region or have intimate knowledge of the region must be able to work for us without the need of sponsorship of any kind must be tech - savvy  -  beyond microsoft office must be able to work within a virtual team environment with proper high - speed internet access what will land me this opportunity ?  a passion for research ,  data intelligence and delivery business experience within a startup environment an awesome attitude ,  personality and willingness to learn and grow what are deal breakers ?  no understanding of the philly region you require some form of sponsorship to work here you re just looking for a steady 9 - 5 job additional information why you ll love working @itprosphilly  culture our culture is performance - driven .  our customers and our team are comprised of technologists who understand that in order to be successful you must deliver a quality product and service ,  which in our case is a compatible technologist .  we work as part of a team .  similar to any sports team ,  each person has a position within the team that bests suits their traits .  everyone steps on the same playing surface on a daily basis to outperform our competition and win .  we are all hands - on ,  from the founder to our interns ,  and we all affect the bottom line .  we believe in you .  you ll be armed with all of the training ,  tools and opportunities to be successful .  team data .  they research ,  upload ,  data mine and present technologist and employer information via the web to asana then assign tasks to our marketing or delivery teams .  stage 1 .  marketing  .  they attract technologists and employers to it pros  -  philadelphia .  stage 2 .  delivery  .  they recruit ,  screen ,  qualify and staff technologists directly with employers within a 50 - mile radius of philadelphia .  stage 3 .  technology google apps for business .  we use gmail ,  gchat ,  google+ hangout ,  drive ,  calendar and chrome for communication between team members .  asana  .  our web / app - based database that houses our candidates ,  employers and projects .  it s our application tracking system  ( ats )  ,  customer relationship management software  ( crm )  and project management task tool .  smartrecruiters  .  the platform we use to post our client job orders and internal job openings .  crushpath  .  how we proactively market our most valuable technologists  ( mvps and smes )  via the web .  youcanbook . me  .  a time saving calendar application used by our delivery team to book discussion times with our prospective candidates .  hootsuite  .  monitors and promotes content to our linkedin ,  twitter ,  google+ and facebook pages .  how to be considered ?  submit your resume ,  along with your linkedin profile or other site that tells us a bit more about you .  include a descriptive message in your application describing how you can help us .  once we receive your application ,  you will be instructed to book a time to speak with one of our team members .  if that goes well ,  we ll schedule a google+ hangout video interview with additional team members .  if we like what we hear ,  the final round will be to meet face - to - face with our founder & ceo in our conference center located in northern liberties .  a decision will be made shortly afterwards .  get to know us linkedin  www . linkedin . com / company / it - pros -  -  - philadelphia facebook  https  /  / www . facebook . com .  .  .

 sun life financial is a global financial institution with a trusted brand name .  headquartered in toronto ,  canada and in wellesley hills ,  ma in the us ,  our mission is to help our clients achieve lifetime financial security .  the stories of how our work and products touch the lives of our clients are truly inspirational .   what’s it like to work at sun life financial ?  you’ll find it dynamic and highly professional  collaborative and supportive .  we encourage career mobility .  sun life is also a socially responsible employer ,  supporting the communities in which we live and work ,  with a globally recognized commitment to the environment and sustainability .   position details   the sun life financial actuarial student program is designed for aspiring actuarial professionals and supports the continuing development of our actuarial community by promoting an environment conducive to a student s successful passing of actuarial exams .   paid summer opportunities are available for qualified students interested in pursuing a career as an actuary and who have or plan to sit for soa exams .   positions are located in our u . s .  headquarters in wellesley ,  ma .   actuarial interns can expect to build computer skills ,  learn insurance concepts and gain an understanding of product features and contracts .  you’ll gain an understanding of the insurance business in general ,  while learning to leverage technology based tools to perform analysis and solve problems .   but it’s not all work .  we offer a complete summer program ,  including lunch & learn sessions ,  networking opportunities with business leaders and members of the actuarial community ,  and social activities with other interns from across the organization .   previous events have included a summer softball game ,  kayaking on the charles river ,  duck tours of boston and a red sox game at historic fenway park .   you’ll also participate in sun life’s involvement with community and charitable organizations through a coordinated volunteer event .     must be currently enrolled in an accredited undergraduate degree program   minimum gpa of 3 . 0 / 4 . 0   demonstrated interest in actuarial profession   prior actuarial internship experience preferred   ability to translate complex ,  abstract concepts and theory   analytical ,  problem - solving and conceptual thinking skills   excellent verbal and written communication skills   proficiency with excel   programming skills preferred  job   actuarial  primary location   us - ma - wellesley  other  our global software leader client has an immediate 6 month contract requirement for a junior - mid level core java developer .  this contract could easily be extended .  in this role ,  you will work as a member of a highly dynamic and mission critical it middleware and soa services team .  this team is tasked with integrating and maintaining the disparate systems that make up the backbone of the online and back - office presence .  duties include document ,  design ,  develop ,  test ,  and release enterprise middleware solutions that conform to enterprise design patterns using the jboss technology stack .  the individual is expected to contribute to the team capabilities and deliverables by demonstrating technical competency ,  personal initiative ,  creativity ,  learning ,  sharing ,  and teamwork .  the individual is also expected to collaborate closely with team members ,  both local and remote ,  and external groups .  primary job responsibilities  analyze and clarify business requirements to implement server - side business logic .  design ,  develop ,  test ,  and maintain rest and soap services conforming to the soa framework .  design ,  develop ,  test ,  and maintain jboss enterprise service bus for application integration conforming to enterprise integration patterns .  document use cases ,  create physical and logical data models ,  and build deployment plans .  analyze log files to help debug problems .  evaluate open source solutions to meet business needs .  provide technical support and ongoing application maintenance .  required skills  2+ years of demonstrated ability to perform object oriented analysis and design .  2+ years of demonstrated ability to implement design patterns in such languages as java ,  and perform linux administration .  2+ years of demonstrated ability to utilize java  ( including ejb3 )  ,  oracle pl / sql ,  mysql ,  hibernate ,  puppet ,  spring ,  and uml .  2+ years of demonstrated ability to develop applications working in an agile development environment .  2+ years of demonstrated ability with distributed source control like git or subversion .  bachelor s in cs ,  engineering ,  or other closely related field .  join a world - class team doing some of the best java development of your career ,  in a world - class work environment !  application requirements client will only consider local candidates .  client will not accept subcontractors you must be authorized to work in the u . s .  on a full - time basis .  required qualifications  j2ee enterprise java beans ejb web services java soa  ( service oriented architecture )  jboss rmi benefits / perks medical dental vision and life insurance for full - time w2 consultants .  supplemental disability and long - term care insurance dependent care assistance .  401 ( k )  with roth feature .  free e - learning courses about matrix whatever your career destination ,  we re how you get there .  for more than 27 years ,  matrix has placed talented contract and permanent it professionals like yourself at thousands of top - notch organizations throughout the u . s .  ,  ranging from fortune 50 to small it shops across all industries .  matrix surrounds you with personal services from assistance with your resume and interviewing skills ,  to background information on the companies you will interview with ,  and more .  once you are onboard as a matrix consultant ,  we offer outstanding benefits ,  a 401 ( k )  program  ( or plan )  ,  discounted training ,  and other valuable incentives .  apply today at matrix .  please note  your resume will never be submitted to a client company without your prior knowledge and consent to do so .
