actuarial intern role does not need or require any soa exam progression .  expected travel  none xerox business services ,  llc and its subsidiaries is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race ,  color ,  creed ,  religion ,  ancestry ,  national origin ,  age ,  gender / sex ,  marital status ,  sexual orientation ,  physical or mental disability ,  use of a guide dog or service animal ,  military / veteran status ,  citizenship status ,  the basis of genetic information or any other group protected by federal or state law or local ordinance .  people with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply or compete for employment with acs may request such accommodation ( s )  by calling 866 -   the mobile web team at zappos is responsible for maintaining and improving the shopping experience for mobile customers using a phone web browser ,  delivering an optimized experience for a growing platform .  we complement and provide an alternative to our highly rated native application experiences for ios ,  android and kindle fire to create rich experiences that make shopping on the mobile web easy ,  intuitive and enjoyable .  our work includes analyzing user studies and working with our analytics team to understand what works and what needs to be improved ,  utilizing split testing to try out new ideas ,  and endlessly seeking performance gains to make a fast ,  fluid experience regardless of the customer s connection speed !   what will you do ?   as a college intern on the mobile web team ,  you will play an important role in our development process .  you’ll work with designers to ensure that our sites communicate the zappos  ( and related )  brands .  as a developer ,  you’ll work with senior members of the mobile web team to create new features in our custom framework ,  using our restful apis and using the awesome technologies and tools available to web developers of today ,  like grunt ,  node . js ,  html5 ,  javascript and nginx !   in this position ,  you’ll be challenged to grow professionally by creating pixel perfect features that work well on everything from a 3 . 5” phone to a 10” tablet .  you will learn about the entire workflow of creating a mobile optimized web site professionally ,  from design ,  brainstorming and split testing through deployment and bug fixing .   cliffnote version    you ll design and brainstorm new features !    you ll code more than anything else !    you ll test !    you ll do it all from sunny las vegas ,  nv and make the mobile web better !   are you a match ?  responsible for the overall productivity results in the store both through successful floor coaching activities and providing individual contributions when not scheduled in the floor coach role .  through the use of delivering customer delight build relationships with customers and understand their needs .  deliver a strong customer experience that will allow the customer to confidently recommend t - mobile to their friends and family .  make wireless terms ,  products and services seem simple and understandable .  ensure that every need the customer has when coming into the store is met before they leave ,  right fitting the solution and making sure you set them up for success through the customer on - boarding process .  build customers confidence by making their experience comfortable ,  simple and solving the whole problem .  know and use the store systems to support the customer experience ,  including the point of sale and customer account management  give support to team when needed .    employee  -  the mobile ux team is seeking a summer intern to complete mobile design deliverables .  this includes but is not limited the following    ? • support user experience strategy and innovation ?  • demonstrates up - to - date expertise in user experience design and applies this to the development ,  execution ,  and improvement of our apps  ? • creates the user experience designs  ( user interface design comps ,  visual design specs ,  prototypes ,  and other visual assets )  for medium - sized ,  diverse projects  ( i . e .  new list tool )   ? • participates in medium - sized ,  diverse ,  cross - functional user experience  ( ux )  projects to generate the overall user experience solution and deliver usability on product within feasibility limits  ? • provides and supports the implementation of business solutions ?   the intern program your intern experience will far beyond your specific assignment .  through the intern executive speaker series ,  tech talks and work - team activities you will be able to gain a greater knowledge of the company as well as the industry .  you will also have the opportunity to participate in a variety of professional development offers ranging from brand knowledge to agile training .   finally and most importantly…being an intern @walmart labs is fun !  whether you are playing a pickup basketball or ping pong game ,  going to the san francisco giants games ,  or taking an intern - only catamaran cruise around the san francisco ,  there is always something going on .  with the san francisco bay area as your playground the opportunities both inside and outside of work are endless !       who are we looking for ?  smart students who are out to change the world !  we are looking for students who are currently pursuing their bachelor’s degree in graphic design or human computer interaction .  must be proficient in photoshop and illustrator .  this is a high energy environment where we solve tough problems and enjoy working with peers who are equally talented and passionate .          apply

boarding process .  build customers confidence by making their experience comfortable ,  simple and solving the whole problem .  know and use the store systems to support the customer experience ,  including the point of sale and customer account management  give support to team when needed .    employee  -  posting job title  direct sales representative requisition #  149500br posting location  wilmington ,  nc ,  us area of interest  sales position type  full time posting job description time warner cable east region direct sales department currently seeks a direct sales representative located in the wilmington ,  nc location .  below please find a brief description of the essential duties and responsibilities required to function successfully in this position . location  wilmington ,  nc purpose  the purpose of this position is to explain and sell cable services to customers in a manner consistent with time warner cable  ( twc )  policies ,  procedures ,  quality standards ,  customer needs and applicable local ,  state and federal regulations .  positions work from lead sheets or an automated sales force automation device to call on homes and increase service penetration in assigned areas .  essential job functions   -  make door - to - door cable sales presentations in order to sell cable services to potential and existing customers in the assigned territory .   -  maximize the potential for customers to purchase and retain their cable services .   -  provide complete and accurate information ,  promote the value of cable effectively and sell based on customer profiles as well as full consideration of all options available .   -  present information regarding products ,  services ,  rates ,  installation fees ,  campaign requirements and special offers in a clear ,  concise ,  accurate and professional manner .   -  promote a positive company image at all times .   -  meet productivity standards set by the department .   -  provide quality customer relations and meet all other performance standards .   -  turn in all sales ,  including required documentation and monies collected in a timely manner .   -  keep accurate records ,  report sales activity and results accurately and notify the supervisor or designee of all problems / difficulties as they occur .   -  follow - up on all leads ,  inquiries ,  complaints and other messages in a timely manner .   -  keep appointments with customers .   -  attend meetings and training sessions as required .   -  quote prices ,  credit terms and prepare sales order forms for orders to be completed and billed .   -  perform other duties as assigned .  qualifications   -  one year of proven commissioned sales experience  or 2 years of college  or equivalent combination of sales experience and college education required .   -  basic math skills required .   -  must be able to work flexible hours .  travel requirements and frequency  must have reliable transportation that will accommodate basic equipment to travel to assigned territories within the system footprint on a daily basis .   -  must have a current valid driver s license with a good driving record .   -  must be able to adhere to the twc motor vehicle record policy .  legal or financial responsibilities   -  requires adherence to twc standards of business conduct .   -  maintains the confidentiality of customer and business data at all times cbtwc 09 / 17 / 13 fcc unit_twc  0593 controlling establishment id  00181  -  wilmington scientific park dr more on twc  time warner cable provides generous benefits .  health care and retirement benefits are significant portions of the total compensation package at twc ,  and we invest more in those benefits than most employers .  in addition ,  we offer tuition reimbursement ,  adoption assistance ,  competitive paid - time - off programs ,  work - life resources ,  and discounted pricing on twc residential products and services for employees within our footprint .  our hope is that ,  by providing our employees with rich and flexible benefits ,  we can help them take care of the people who matter most – at work and at home .  time warner cable is an equal opportunity employer m / f / d / v .

 requirements  • passionate about software development .  • must have a disciplined ,  methodical ,  minimalist approach to designing and constructing layered software components that can be embedded within larger frameworks or applications .  • experience in object oriented design and programming ,  proficient in applying common design patterns ,  ability to communicate design ideas effectively .  • proficient in major development tools and processes ,  such as source control ,  requirement spec ,  design and design review ,  unit test ,  system test ,  performance test ,  etc .  • strong verbal and written communication skills are a must .  • bs in computer science or related fields .  • understanding of ios with experience with objective - c ,  cocoa touch and ios development • solid understanding of algorithms ,  data structures ,  object oriented design ,  and user experience fundamentals • experience programming with the mvc  /  mvp pattern in a modern mobile application framework • experience using modern version control systems • able to professionally communicate with management ,  clients and coworkers on the phone ,  in email ,  and in person responsibilities  • analyze the market place ,  competition and technology trends to bring innovative ,  out - of - the - box solutions to life .  • collaborate to prioritize and set direction of development efforts .  gather requirements to formulate appropriate architecture required to provide complete functionality ensuring high performance and strong user experience .  • contribute ideas for continually improving the team’s productivity ,  job enjoyment ,  and code quality .  • research new technology and tools in our space to remain abreast of current and emerging technology .  propose and execute on research / prototype projects that introduce an innovative solution to new or existing problem .  • communicate cross multiple teams to show case new features and functionalities .  • have fun and be passionate !   as part of our team ,  you ll be responsible for new features and improvements from concept through release to production .  you ll also be part of the group that decides what we ll be including in new versions ,  so being able to connect features to customer impact is a must .  once you re working on that awesome feature ,  you re responsible for creating high quality and well tested code .  you should play well with our feisty mobile qa counterparts .   beyond coding ,  you ll be partly responsible for coming up with new and exciting ways to market our apps to our customers ,  and you ll also be working with public relations teams to promote your new features as they go live .  and ,  of course ,  you ll have to do it all on a  ( loose )  schedule and without close direct supervision .   the cliffsnotes     you ll be building java services on top of the spring framework   you ll get a peek inside the beast that is amazon . com as you tie us into their services   test - driven design will be a reality ,  as integration tests are a must   as we head towards continuous deployment ,  you ll be leading the charge  are you a match ?     computer science or related major preferred ,  or if you have a passion for mobile development we’re ok with that too !    you must eat ,  sleep ,  and drink java  ( both the programming language and the beverage )  .    experience working with version control  primarily github   experience working with mysql   experience building mobile specific web experiences   exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with a customer service orientation   detail oriented and organized   normal working business hours are monday through friday 8 30 a . m .  to 5 30 p . m .    must be willing to relocate to las vegas ,  nv for the summer of 2014  ( did we mention we have some sweet housing lined up ?  !  )   team fun fact   in our new offices downtown ,  the mobile team has the best view in all of tech !  we are right by the windows and can see all the way to the mountains .   if you are interested ,  please apply directly on internships . zappos . com .  don t apply on here because we will direct you to internships . zappos . com .  doing more with less !   zappos . com ,  inc .  is an equal opportunity employer and drug - free workplace .

 sports  responsible for learning to produce clear ,  concise and accurate sports segments and stories as assigned .  select and prepare graphics and editorial content .  assist in shooting and editing sports video and stories utilizing field cameras ,  gear and editing systems .  assist in developing and producing sports feature and franchise stories .  assist in producing weekly high school football show .  learn to archive video that will give the department easy access for future use .  maintain thorough knowledge of sports in cable viewing .  qualifications  candidates for internships must   -  posting job title  ny1 technical operations internship  -  fall 2013 requisition #  148367br posting location  new york ,  ny ,  us area of interest  cable television production position type  intern posting job description on september 8 ,  1992 ,  a new form of media  -  ny1 news  -  was launched .  ny1 is a 24 - hour news channel ,  serving new york city s five boroughs ,  parts of westchester and hudson valley as well as bergen and hudson counties in nj .  available exclusively to more than 2 million cable subscribers on channel 1 on time warner cable systems ,  ny1 covers the city with more than 40 full - time reporters and is completely dedicated to new york city news and information .  ny1 expanded into new york city s latino community by launching the city s first 24 - hour spanish - language news channel ,  ny1 noticias in june 2003 .  the channel is available on time warner cable s dtv channel 801 .  since its inception ,  ny1 news has become an indispensable community asset and is now the model for cable news channels nationwide .  by combining innovative technology with a strong commitment to reporting ,  ny1 presents viewers with the most comprehensive new york city news ,  sports ,  weather ,  business and features .  for new yorkers ,  new york 1 is the only local news worth watching .  summary we offer opportunities to students who are motivated and eager to learn about broadcast journalism and gain valuable experience in a newsroom environment .  the following departments are looking for interns who will help plan ,  execute and coordinate various aspects of news media .  technical interns  -  video editing  interns will shadow video editors learning every angle of the job .  depending on skill level ,  interns may have the opportunity to edit reporter packages for air .   -  technical operations  interns will mix audio ,  set up studio sets ,  operate robotic cameras and still store ,  call up teleprompter scripts ,  and provide lighting support .   -  eng  interns will work with the eng assistants to organize and maintain the cameras and other support gear for the field crews .  they will also occasionally work to support field crews and live trucks on remote shoots .   -  engineering  interns will work with engineers on upgrades ,  installations and maintenance of broadcast equipment and software  ( including production control rooms ,  edit suites and master controls .  )  interns will also help engineering staff document changes made on any transmission path .  candidates with knowledge of it and systems integrations preferred .  other ny1 internship opportunities creative  148187br  ( creative services )  and 148191br  ( graphics )   -  about the company  ?  appdynamics was just rated   #1 cloud computing software company to work for   by forbes !  ?  we are changing the way web apps are operated in a culture that fosters creativity and collaboration .  we host a variety of fun company outings like giants games ,  day trips to napa ,  and monthly happy hours .  ?  our office ,  located in downtown san francisco next to giants stadium and the waterfront ,  features an open floor plan ,  a game room complete with ping - pong ,  darts ,  foosball ,  and xbox ,  and a kitchen that is consistently stocked with delicious snacks and drinks .  we pay interns top rates and give them meaty ,  forward - looking projects that make a real impact on our business .  check out our website ,  www . appdynamics . com  ,  to get a better feel for what we do .  about the position  real - user monitoring is a brand - new feature for analyzing the performance of your web app from the perspective of the web browser .  here are some of the problems you could help us solve  how can a javascript library   hack   its host page to measure and report all the interesting things that happen ?  how about an objective - c library in a mobile app ?  how can we understand ,  and help our users understand ,  the performance of their web app across browsers ,  devices ,  pages ,  and geographies ?  how can we automatically find the patterns that make an app slow ,  using statistics and machine learning ?  about you  you are a solid ,  creative ,  up - and - coming software engineer .  you ve taken hard classes and worked on projects outside class because you love building software .  you want to learn from smart people ,  solve interesting problems ,  and see your code running on tens of thousands of computers .  you try to understand your users so you can make their lives better .   ?  our interns are long - term investments ,  so we are not looking for specialized skills .  you should be decent on the command - line ,  intimately familiar with a modern programming language ,  and you should either know java or be willing to learn it before you start .  you should be interested in what we do and eager to learn more .

machine interfaces that are cross - platform and span mobile ,  tablet ,  and laptop / desktop devices ,  and storage of time - series data with efficient access to the stored data leveraging various retrieval paradigms including sampling and aggregation in the cloud .  exposure to microsoft’s azure platform - as - a - service platform is desirable but not required .  exposure to html 5 ,  json  ,  java & visual studio  . net would be useful but not required . minimum qualifications bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering ,  computer engineering ,  or computer science .  demonstrated academic excellence  3 . 25 cumulative gpa minimum strong interpersonal and communication skills .  analytical problem -  junior systems administrator  ( job number 329849 )  description  saic s integrated systems group currently has an opening for a junior windows systems administrator in the suitland ,  md area .  position / program summary  the system administrator activities shall encompass client / server operations and maintenance ,  configuration management ,  installations ,  performance ,  capacity planning and office automation ,  system management ,  backup / recovery ,  trouble calls ,  account management ,  configuration management ,  and cloud computing .  primary responsibilities  the system administrator will perform the following activities  • monitoring and analyzing system / application activity and performance .  • providing installation ,  maintenance ,  administration ,  upgrading ,  security ,  documentation and configuration .  • ensure that all workstations / servers have the most up - to - date signature file release for that reporting period .  • coordinate routine software or hardware preventive maintenance and backup schedules with the government and other vendors .  • respond via telephone to server or critical watch outages and where required ,  provide on - site support .  • create accounts for network access submitted through remedy ars system with the work log updated accordingly .  • maintain server configuration documentation and provide scheduled and ad hoc reporting .  qualifications  basic qualifications  candidates must have 1 year experience with windows server os .  candidates must have the following experience and knowledge  • working knowledge of windows servers and workstations candidates must have the following certifications  • security+ • 1 windows certification  -  candidates must have an active ts / sci clearance • candidates must meet dod 8570 . 1m requirements portions of saic to be renamed leidos ,  inc .  ,  subject to stockholder approval and consummation of a separation transaction if approved by saic board of directors .  saic is pursuing a plan to separate into two independently traded companies  one that provides technical ,  engineering and enterprise information technology services primarily to the u . s .  government  ( new saic )  ,  and one that delivers technical solutions in national security ,  engineering and health  ( leidos ,  inc )  .  saic overview  saic is a fortune 500® scientific ,  engineering ,  and technology applications company that uses its deep domain knowledge to solve problems of vital importance to the nation and the world ,  in national security ,  energy & environment ,  health and cybersecurity .  the company s approximately 41 , 000 employees serve customers in the u . s .  department of defense ,  the intelligence community ,  the u . s .  department of homeland security ,  other u . s .  government civil agencies and selected commercial markets .  headquartered in mclean ,  va .  ,  saic had annual revenues of approximately $10 . 6 billion for its fiscal year ended january 31 ,  2012 .  for more information ,  visit www . saic . com .  saic  from science to solutions® job posting  aug 1 ,  2013 ,  4 49 24 pm primary location  united states - md - landover clearance level must currently possess  top secret / sci clearance level must be able to obtain  none potential for teleworking  no travel  yes ,  10% of the time shift  yes ,  10% of the time schedule  full -  vmware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 400 , 000 enterprise and smb customers to thrive in the cloud era by simplifying ,  automating and transforming the way they build ,  deliver and consume it .  as a team ,  our employees thrive on forward momentum .  we are an engine of opportunity fueled by the transformative products and solutions we bring to market ,  the passion and trust we inspire in our customers ,  and our collaborative drive to imagine ,  define and deliver the future of it through cloud computing .  with 13 , 000+ employees and 50+ locations worldwide ,  we are a passionate ,  innovative and driven group of people inspired by the opportunity to actively learn and contribute something back to the broader community .  connect with us at www . vmware . com / careers .   job description  the pricing analytics intern at vmware will work closely with members of the pricing and marketing planning organization to provide insight and analysis on pricing strategy ,  pricing policy ,  and compliance .  the pricing analytics intern will receive substantial guidance ,  feedback ,  and mentoring from the pricing and marketing planning team but will also have the opportunity to independently develop solutions to assignments .   responsibilities   -  build price optimization models based on an analysis of variables including value to the customer ,  market research data ,  country and / or region specific pricing conditions ,  and competitor price  -  build models to assess the financial impact of various pricing scenarios  -  analyze the underlying assumptions ,  economic logic ,  and key variables in pricing proposals  -  research and drive regulatory compliance requirements for pricing to the government sector  -  investigate and recommend enhancements to existing pricing programs  -  analyze past pricing program effectiveness  -  analyze pricing committee presentations ,  requests and manage meeting logistics  project examples   -  develop a framework / model for pricing in local currency in new markets  ( china ,  korea ,  latam )   -  develop a frame for service provider pricing / usage based pricing model  requirements  if you are a first - year mba student focused on finance ,  quantitative marketing ,  or economics and are looking for an internship in the high - tech software industry then you should strongly consider career opportunities at vmware .  in this position we look for a person with these characteristics    -  strong analytical and problem - solving skills  -  ability to create models that provide “what if” capabilities  -  ability to work under tight deadlines  -  ability to decompose and analyze key variables and assumptions in models for pricing proposals  -  strong understanding of the economic principals and related mathematics underlying pricing optimization  -  strong interpersonal skills ,  including the ability to communicate effectively in person ,  over the telephone and via email   -    please note we have multiple pricing analyst opportunities available  how to apply  please submit your resume for consideration to  http  /  / www . vmware . com .  .  .   vmw2 location palo alto ,  ca ,  us is this a remote or multiple location position .  .  .  requisition number 45569br eeo statement vmware is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees .  equal opportunity and consideration are afforded to all qualified applicants and employees in personnel actions ,  which include  recruiting and hiring ,  selection for training ,  promotion ,  rates of pay or other compensation ,  transfer ,  discipline ,  demotion ,  layoff or termination .  vmware does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race ,  color ,  religion ,  sexual orientation ,  marital status ,  pregnancy ,  gender identity ,  gender expression ,  family medical history or genetic information ,  citizenship ,  national origin or ancestry ,  sex ,  age ,  physical or mental disability ,  medical condition ,  veteran status ,  military status ,  or any other basis protected by federal ,  state or local law ,  ordinance or regulation .  vmware also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law .  further ,  it is the policy of vmware to maintain a working environment free of all forms of harassment .  note to applicant  please disable your pop -  cryptography  ( please note  this is a supervised ,  entry - level internship addressing business need through technology and application development .  it requires less than 18 months of experience in the field of study and current enrollment in a college or university .  )  about rackspace hosting rackspace hosting is the service leader in cloud computing and the founder of openstack ,  the leading open source cloud platform .  we deliver enterprise - level managed hosting ,  cloud hosting and e - mail hosting services to businesses of all types and sizes around the world .  we serve over 180 , 000 customers from data centers around the world ,  and that number continues to grow .  rackspace integrates the industry s best technologies and practices for each customer s specific needs ,  delivering it as a service via the company s commitment to fanatical support® .  for the over 5 , 000+ current rackers ,  however ,  we are much more than a hosting company .  rackspace offers a vibrant company culture filled with compelling work ,  a supportive team environment and a lot of fun .  we are as fanatical® about serving our clients and one another as we are about building the future of technology .  we compete in the same space as amazon ,  microsoft and google because the work that rackers do allows us to lead the race for innovation and quality .  rackers’ opinions ,  ideas and creativity are pushed to the limit because pushing beyond the boundaries of today’s hosting standards is the only way to be number one .  the pressure is on—are you ready ?  but ,  don’t take it from us—rackspace’s awards and recognitions include   -  the workday ux team is bringing consumer style interactions to business processes .  if you share our passion for simplicity and the belief that business applications should be strikingly better ,  this may be the place for you .  this internship will be a great opportunity to gain hands on ,  professional experience in ux design and user research .  become part of a ux team that thrives on sharing feedback and supporting each other .  responsibilities distill complex problems into simple and elegant user experiences for a range of target users and platforms including mobile and the web .  creatively apply the best user interface design ideas of the consumer web to business applications .  create wireframes and prototypes .  create innovative and cutting edge user interactions .  conduct user research and usability testing .  skills / requirements you have a ba / bs or ms degree preferred in hci ,  or related field .  you are a creative thinker .  you are familiar with web technologies and have an appetite for learning .  you love all things mobile ,  social ,  and cutting edge .  you are familiar with wireframing and prototyping .  you can communicate effectively .  about workday workday is the leader in enterprise - class ,  software - as - a - service  ( saas )  solutions for managing global businesses .  our solutions combine the lower cost of ownership of saas with a modern approach to applications .  the workday experience is the combination of everything that ? s unique about workday  our culture ,  our core values ,  our company meetings ,  cantina happy hours ,  our soccer team ,  our recognition programs ,  but most importantly it ? s our people .  it ? s everything that makes us different from your average employer ,  and everything that makes workday a great place to spend a workday .  at workday ,  we are committed to equal employment opportunity .  workday does not accept resumes from headhunters ,  placement agencies or other suppliers that have not signed a formal agreement with us .  our supplier base is restricted to specified hiring needs .  therefore ,  any resume received from an unapproved supplier will be considered unsolicited ,  and workday will not be obligated to pay a referral or placement fee .

hand experience and gain valuable insight as to how interactive projects are designed ,  developed and launched .  candidates must be creative problem solvers ,  innovative designers ,  and passionate user advocates .  you must also thrive in a fast - paced ,  team - based ,  environment that believes in failing fast and delivering results .   desired skills & experience    should be an undergraduate or graduate student pursuing a interaction design degree or in a related program   an understanding of usability research principles and how to conduct usability interviews   strong knowledge of the adobe creative suite   ability to produce wireframes and / or prototypes using omnigraffle ,  photoshop ,  or other design tools   strong eye for typography ,  color ,  and layout   a passion for clean ,  accessible ,  and functional responsive design   an understanding of design’s role in creative problem solving   passionate about design and stays current with design trends   basic knowledge of html and  css

 zappos . com ,  inc .  is looking for a front end development college intern !   why join us ?  our unique culture has made zappos . com ,  inc .  and its subsidiaries one of fortune’s 100 best companies to work for five years straight .  find out why  http  /  / money . cnn . com .  .  .   why else .  .  .  .   want more ?  summer interns may qualify for corporate housing assistance ,  free food and drinks on our campus ,  social events throughout the internship ,  and a 40 percent off discount on zappos . com !   if you are interested ,  please go to internships . zappos . com and apply directly to the position on there !   who are we ?   the front - end team at zappos  ( aka fez )  is a close - knit group of developers who work to make sure the website is looking and acting its best .  we take the all the complex user and product data passed from the backend and package it into a pretty box .  we then wrap it with the recommendations offered to us from ux and make sure it s delivered in a way that s maintainable ,  speedy ,  and stable .   we are always looking towards new technologies and methodologies to make this process better .  we primarily work with css / html / javascript and different templating languages .  we are always looking for new ways to make things better for our customers ,  so you will always have lots of interesting problems to solve .   beyond all the technology ,  fez tries to blaze the trail of what it means to be a family and drive culture in a place where the bar is already set high .  we have gone on a lot of fun outings over the years .  these have included hiking zion national park ,  colorado river boating ,  magic mountain ,  the san diego zoo ,  and a san francisco tour .   what will you do ?    we re looking for a front - end web development intern who lives and breathes web standards .  you will have experience with standards - compliant ,  semantic html and css ,  knowledge of native javascript ,  dom scripting and familiarity with javascript frameworks like jquery ,  mustache ,  etc .  we work with a lot of  nix based technologies ,  so experience with shell scripting and gnu tools will be very beneficial ,  too .   you ll be learning the best practices for web development and learning exciting new technologies .  as you get up to speed ,  you ll be assisting with large and small projects that are fun ,  challenging and span the spectrum of front - end development on any one of a number of zappos development’s websites ,  such as  zappos . com ,  6pm . com or vip . zappos . com .   we re looking for people with great personalities who are team players .  when a project is done ,  we ll celebrate ,  enjoy the view and look forward to the next project wiser and stronger than before .   the cliffsnotes     learning best practices for web development   discovering new technologies   sharpening the skills you already have   semantic html / css coding / updating for assigned projects   javascript / dom scripting to build interactive but accessible interfaces   collaboration with ux team and business users to plan ,  prototype & build cool new features   maintenance / updates to existing sites   playing cards against humanity  are you a match ?     web development or computer science major preferred ,  or if you just have a strong passion and knowledge of front - end development ,  we are okay with that too !    ability to create layouts using advanced and semantic html5 and css3   knowledge of dom scripting with native javascript and js frameworks such as jquery   understanding of javascript performance optimization techniques   experience using apis and an understanding of http and rest architecture   an understanding of modern web practices to create an efficient user - experience   comfortable working in a  nix environment and using gnu tools   excellent written and oral communication skills   consistent with and exemplifies our core values   must be a team player and open to change   fun and friendly attitude   normal working business hours are monday through friday 9 00 a . m .  to 5 30 p . m .    must be willing to relocate to las vegas ,  nv for the summer of 2014  ( did we mention we have some sweet housing lined up ?  !  )   team fun fact   we once had a running of the bulls parade where the bull s butt spewed hershey kisses and yoohoo .   if you are interested ,  please apply directly on internships . zappos . com .  don t apply on here because we will direct you to internships . zappos . com .  doing more with less !   zappos . com ,  inc .  is an equal opportunity employer and drug - free workplace .

up front desk personnel with answering the phone .  funds deposit prepare investment reports using portfolio center  ( centerpiece )  or lpl portfolio manager .  review accounts to determine if forms are up - to - date .  prepare forms for client signatures  ( hardcopy and e - signature )  .  confirm / correct account networking .  prepare insurance applications for client signature .  follow up as required to ensure receipt and processing open new accounts and prepare new account applications .  monitor cash balances in client accounts for distribution needs and to alert ca of cash that needs to be invested .  perform trades in client accounts .  prepare and maintain up - to - date prospectuses and forms as required for client accounts .  maintain compliance files in preparation for regulatory audits .  track mailing and receipt of client consulting agreements .  interface with lpl compliance and legal departments on information requests at the direction of the compliance officer or branch manager .  the successful candidate will have  lpl or other broker experience required trade and rebalancing software experience required portfolio reporting software experience strongly desired series 7 and 66 licenses required 4 year degree in business or finance 2+ years experience in the financial industry ability to work in a team environment is critical .  able to act independently .  tenacious ,  tactful ,  willing to continually follow - day adventist church and who support the published mission of the university .     the assistant dean - finance & admin for the loma linda university school of nursing  ( son )  will provide leadership for the accomplishment of financial activities of the dean’s office of the son .  these activities include financial controls ,  financial budgeting ,  development of son pay scales ,  financial analysis ,  formal and informal presentations ,  compliance with the policies and procedures of loma linda university ,  the maintenance of personnel files ,  the administration of the son office and facilities / operations management for the son .  performs other duties as needed .  job specifications  bachelor’s degree in business or associated field required .  master’s degree preferred .  minimum three years’ operations experience in business or associated field with two years of supervisory experience required .   public relations experience highly desirable .  proficient in people skills ,  verbal and written communication ,  computer data input ,  word processing ,  spread sheets ,  keyboarding ,  microsoft office software and telephone skills .  proficiency in motor skills ,  hand -  fidelity investments is committed to delivering the best customer experience in the financial services industry .  we help millions of people save and invest through personal investment accounts and workplace savings plans .  our associates build long - term relationships with our customers ,  helping them navigate our full range of investor products and services ,  including one - on - one investment guidance ,  wealth management ,  retirement planning ,  income strategies ,  and college planning services ,  as well as integrated employee benefits solutions  we have 170+ fidelity investor centers across the united states and continue to open several new branches each year .  branch representatives offer guidance and personalized investment solutions to our customers in a face - to - face setting ,  and help extend the reach of fidelity s brand .  it is our priority to deliver customized and effective service ,  and successfully anticipate clients’ emerging needs .  at fidelity ,  you’ll have the support of a well - rounded team of professionals ,  with full access to some of the best resources and tools in the industry .  while you build relationships here ,  you’ll also be building your career .   position description  the financial representative acts as first point of contact in the branch .  this role works with all customer segments ,  mass market to pcg and provides exceptional service introducing prospects to the full array of fidelity products and services .  the licensed financial representative  ( lfr )  services the customer while uncovering and qualifying potential leads for sales opportunities through face - to - face in branch contact and proactive outbound calling .  this role is responsible for front counter ,  phone coverage ,  deposits ,  bank wires ,  basic account information ,  simple account maintenance and managing the daily transaction processing volumes for the branch .   primary responsibilities    acts as a primary counter rep  ( triage walk - ins )  .    responsible for educating clients on the services and products available to them to more effectively monitor ,  maintain ,  service and manage their investments .    coordinates overall schedules and appointments for the s ( ae )  and lobby .    fulfills client transactional informational and service needs .    sets up ,  inputs and enters data to the brokerage and shareholder systems which includes account maintenance ,  processing checks ,  disbursements ,  securities ,  toas ,  priority new account set up conduit to processing groups ,  cashiering ,  adjustments ,  etc .    responsible for customer literature supplies and inventory management .    responsible for arranging payment for incidental branch expenses .    handles outgoing customer mail ,  outgoing internal mail ,  incoming mail ,  imaging customer paperwork ,  etc .    processes checks ,  disbursements ,  securities ,  toas and priority new account set ups .    acts as a conduit to processing groups ,  cashiering ,  adjustments ,  etc .    adheres to compliance / risk procedures and exhibits detailed attention to disclosure policies .    serves as quality control point to ensure that all calls ,  paperwork ,  policy and procedures for customer requests have been adhered to in accordance with compliance requirements .    assists with seminar preparation and enrollment and presents basic seminars   responsible for fundamental guidance  ( simple planning ,  appointments )  .    identifies additional customer needs and introduces additional fidelity products and services .    provides investment information / guidance to mass market .    works closely with manager and other representatives to recognize opportunities to retain and build fidelity assets .   qualifications  education and experience    college degree preferred    prior customer service ,  sales ,  or phone experience required    experience or strong interest in sales required  skills and knowledge    series 7 preferred  ( required within 6 months of hire )      series 63 preferred ,  required within 90 days of passing the series 7 exam    insurance license desired    banking ,  insurance ,  or financial experience preferred    superb interpersonal ,  customer interaction ,  and communication skills are needed    pc / windows experience required  about fidelity investments fidelity investments is one of the world s largest providers of financial services .  founded in 1946 ,  the firm is a leading provider of investment management ,  retirement planning ,  portfolio guidance ,  brokerage ,  benefits outsourcing and many other financial products and services to more than 20 million individuals and institutions ,  as well as through 5 , 000 financial intermediary firms .  for more information about fidelity investments ,  visit www . fidelity . com .   fidelity investments is an equal opportunity employer .   job    customer service / operations  primary location    ca - los angeles  -  investor center  schedule    full - time  job level    individual contributor  education level    bachelor s degree  ( ±16 years )   job type    standard  shift    day job  overtime status    non - exempt  travel    no     
 our branch banking teammates are often the first to meet new clients and the ones who start them on the path to reaching their financial goals .  we help them buy homes ,  grow businesses ,  send kids to college and build their futures .   by having a conversation ,  we can understand what our clients need ,  and can create customized product and service solutions that address them .  our most important job as the face of suntrust is to build a lasting relationship that help us match our clients with the exact solutions they need to help them reach their financial goals .   the in - store  nyu langone medical center ,  a world - class ,  patient - centered ,  integrated ,  academic medical center ,  is one of the nation s premier centers for excellence in clinical care ,  biomedical research and medical education .  located in the heart of manhattan ,  nyu langone is composed of four hospitals  -  tisch hospital ,  its flagship acute care facility  rusk rehabilitation  the hospital for joint diseases ,  one of only five hospitals in the nation dedicated to orthopaedics and rheumatology  and hassenfeld pediatric center ,  a comprehensive pediatric hospital supporting a full array of children s health services across the medical center  -  plus the nyu school of medicine ,  which since 1841 has trained thousands of physicians and scientists who have helped to shape the course of medical history .  the medical center s tri - fold mission to serve ,  teach and discover is achieved 365 days a year through the seamless integration of a culture devoted to excellence in patient care ,  education and research .  for more information ,  go to www . nyulmc . org .   we have an exciting opportunity to join our team as a financial services representative in the finance department .  to qualify you must have a high school diploma or equivalent with a minimum of one year office experience or an equivalent combination of education and work experience .  the successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring maximum reimbursement to the medical center by performing functions charge posting ,  collection and cashiering  entering ,  verifying and updating patient information  linking the patient -  the customer billing and reimbursement call center representative works as part of the third party finance department to resolve all cvs external customer billing & reimbursement issues within corporate designated service level agreements  ( slas )  .  the representative will be responsible for answering incoming calls related to customer billing statements ,  issues related to possible customer reimbursements ,  general inquiries ,  as well as for the resolution of customer payment concerns related to pharmacy claims .  the representative will work with other areas within third party to obtain the necessary information to resolve customer billing and reimbursement inquiries while also ensuring optimum levels of customer satisfaction by serving each caller according to the cvs / caremark company vision ,  mission ,  and values .   required qualifications  strong phone and customer service skills with prior experience in call center preferred  ( customer service ,  retail ,  pharmacy ,  or health insurance claims processing  -  medicaid or medicare  -  preferred )  strong diagnostic and organizational skills with a strong attention to detail ,  accuracy ,  and follow through .  basic working knowledge of all ms office applications  ( ms word ,  excel ,  access and outlook )   preferred qualifications  ability to complete routine assigned work based on productivity standards with minimal supervision .  excellent verbal and written communication skills .  must be able to articulate information in a clear and concise manner .  ability to receive guidance and supervision and follow all process and procedures .   education  bachelors preferred ,  but not required .   business overview  cvs caremark ,  through our unmatched breadth of service offerings ,  is transforming the delivery of health care services in the u . s .  we are an innovative ,  fast - growing company guided by values that focus on teamwork ,  integrity and respect for our colleagues and customers .  what are we looking for in our colleagues ?  we seek fresh ideas ,  new perspectives ,  a diversity of experiences ,  and a dedication to service that will help us better meet the needs of the many people and businesses that rely on us each day .  as the nation’s largest pharmacy health care provider ,  we offer a wide range of exciting and fulfilling career opportunities across our three business units – minuteclinic ,  pharmacy benefit management  ( pbm )  and retail pharmacy .  our energetic and service - oriented colleagues work hard every day to make a positive difference in the lives of our customers .

 accounting analyst intern – corporate finance internship program - 130036847  at u . s .  bank ,  we re passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work .  the fifth - largest bank in the united states ,  we’re one of the country s most respected ,  innovative and successful financial institutions .  u . s .  bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce .   the u . s .  bank corporate finance internship program is designed to give its participants unprecedented access to executive management and challenge them to immerse themselves in the world of banking at u . s .  bank’s headquarters in minneapolis .   in addition to their daily role in one of u . s .  bank’s business units ,  interns meet weekly with direct reports to the chief executive officer ,  as well as other senior executives ,  and begin the summer with classroom training taught by senior management from throughout the bank .   participants in the 2014 corporate finance internship program will experience the following    .   ·         weekly lunches with executive management .   past interns enjoyed meeting the chief financial officer ,  vice chairman of corporate banking ,  vice chairman of wealth management ,  vice chairman of wholesale banking ,  vice chairman of commercial real estate ,  vice chairman of community banking & branch delivery ,  executive vice president of human resources ,  treasurer ,  controller ,  and other members of the executive team .   ·         comprehensive training sessions on the banking industry and u . s .  bank business units led by senior management .   ·         competition in a bank valuation case study .   intern teams work with u . s .  bank’s corporate development  ( internal m&a )  group to value a bank and present their valuation to a panel of senior executives ,  including the director of corporate development ,  at summer end .   ·         mentorship from a young leader at the bank to provide guidance on career - related questions and make introductions .   ·         social and professional networking events throughout the summer .   interns with an accounting focus are placed in one of u . s .  bank’s many accounting - related business units ,  including the following   external reporting ,  corporate tax ,  accounting policy ,  corporate accounting ,  corporate payables ,  controller’s office of research and reconciliations .   qualifications  qualifications   • major in accounting ,  finance ,  economics or related field .   • completion of junior year  ( or equivalent credits )   • strong interest in the banking industry  • excellent verbal and written communication skills  • well developed quantitative and analytical skills  • ability to work independently and also in a team environment  job administrative  /  clerical  primary location minnesota - mn - minneapolis  shift 1st   -  daytime  travel no  average hours per week 40

 basic objective  provide a well - rounded educational work experience for a student seeking an accounting or finance career in the manufacturing industry .  the intern will work under the direction of an assigned mentor within their specific area of placement ,  thus providing them with a contact for questions related to job responsibilities ,  personal development ,  or the company in general .  specific responsibilities  1 .  perform various analyses of financial data that is used for decision making within the business unit in which they are placed .  2 .  participates in process improvement activities within the accounting and finance areas .  these activities may involve participation on business process redesign teams that are assigned to deal with particular processes that are in need of improvement .  3 .  assists with the financial planning / standard costing process within the particular area of placement .  4 .  responsible for performing post audits of major capital expenditures or of new product introductions enabling management to evaluate the success of such projects .  5 .  may participate in analysis of the income statement and reconciliation of the balance sheet for the particular business or area of placement .  6 .  assists with the annual physical inventory process by participating as a team member of the audit team assigned to that particular inventory .  7 .  exposure to erp systems environment including sap and platinum .  8 .  applies general accounting and finance knowledge to learning and understanding kohler co .  policies and procedures effectively and quickly leading to advanced levels of responsibilities .  9 .  conducts other special studies and projects under the direction of supervision .  relationships and contacts  1 .  supervisory  -  reports to a designated mentor within the area of placement .  has frequent contact with corporate staff controller and manager of human resources for finance throughout the internship .  2 .  internal  -  frequent interaction with various members of kohler co .  accounting staff and also members of operations ,  marketing ,  and sales teams .  3 .  external  -  occasional interaction with the company s outside accounting firm .  education and experience requirements  1 .  this program is intended as a first practical work experience  therefore ,  previous work experience is not required .  2 .  the ideal candidate will be a well - motivated accounting and / or finance major with the drive and discipline to work with minimal supervision .  because kohler offers full time positions to nearly 75% of its interns ,  students applying for the internship should be graduating within one year from the start of the internship with kohler .  3 .  must have excellent interpersonal skills combined with a willingness to develop .

 vmware is the leader in virtualization and cloud infrastructure solutions that enable our more than 400 , 000 enterprise and smb customers to thrive in the cloud era by simplifying ,  automating and transforming the way they build ,  deliver and consume it .  as a team ,  our employees thrive on forward momentum .  we are an engine of opportunity fueled by the transformative products and solutions we bring to market ,  the passion and trust we inspire in our customers ,  and our collaborative drive to imagine ,  define and deliver the future of it through cloud computing .  with 13 , 000+ employees and 50+ locations worldwide ,  we are a passionate ,  innovative and driven group of people inspired by the opportunity to actively learn and contribute something back to the broader community .  connect with us at www . vmware . com / careers .   responsibilities  a financial planning & analysis  ( fp&a )  intern at vmware will work closely with members of the finance organization to provide insight and analysis to our business partners in the products organization .  an fp&a intern will receive substantial guidance ,  feedback and mentoring from the fp&a team ,  but will also have the opportunity to independently develop solutions to assignments .   the intern will own a significant project and will also be assigned ongoing analysis and reporting deliverables .   potential projects include   -  establishing a better financial framework for evaluating the success of oem agreements  -  providing financial analysis for software as a service  ( saas )  business plans  -  analyzing competitor financial results and forecasts  -  modeling costs & benefits of various r&d efficiency initiatives  areas of ongoing analysis and modeling may include the following   -  analyzing and reporting business unit results  -  providing data and analysis for performance dashboards  at the culmination of the internship ,  the intern will present results from the project to senior finance management and business partners .   requirements  if you are a first - year mba student with coursework in strategy ,  operations ,  accounting ,  and finance and are looking for an internship in high - tech ,  then you should strongly consider career opportunities in finance strategic planning at vmware .  in general we look for   -  a record of rigorous course work and outstanding academic achievement  -  strong analytical ,  financial modeling and problem - solving skills  -  ability to manipulate data and work with different data sources  -  ability to work effectively with a wide variety of people using strong written and oral communication skills  -  proficiency using excel ,  word ,  access and powerpoint  -  additional coursework in management information systems or managing technology a plus  -  previous work experience in management consulting ,  systems ,  or finance is a plus   -   please note we have multiple financial analyst opportunities  please apply via  http  /  / www . vmware . com .  .  .   vmw2 location palo alto ,  ca ,  us is this a remote or multiple location position .  .  .  requisition number 45568br eeo statement vmware is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees .  equal opportunity and consideration are afforded to all qualified applicants and employees in personnel actions ,  which include  recruiting and hiring ,  selection for training ,  promotion ,  rates of pay or other compensation ,  transfer ,  discipline ,  demotion ,  layoff or termination .  vmware does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race ,  color ,  religion ,  sexual orientation ,  marital status ,  pregnancy ,  gender identity ,  gender expression ,  family medical history or genetic information ,  citizenship ,  national origin or ancestry ,  sex ,  age ,  physical or mental disability ,  medical condition ,  veteran status ,  military status ,  or any other basis protected by federal ,  state or local law ,  ordinance or regulation .  vmware also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law .  further ,  it is the policy of vmware to maintain a working environment free of all forms of harassment .  note to applicant  please disable your pop - to - face support of traders assisting them on a wide range of technical challenges which could cover anything from electronic trading through to their real time bond & cds risk and / or pnl .  the job entails complex problem solving tasks ,  which could span not only our own front office trading systems but also through to our downstream settlement and financial control systems .  the role involves start of day system checkouts ,  rapid diagnosis of production problems ,  and escalation of issues to the appropriate teams in a timely manner when required .  the role involves the development of realtime reports using clojure ,  and also scripting of bespoke forward - thinking monitoring which facilitates us in catching issues before the impact our users .  any ideas to streamline and automate our daily processes are actively encouraged .  there is also a business analysis and project management element to the role ,  as all support staff also perform an sme / application manager role for at least one of our applications .  as we are the closest team to the business we are often best placed to identify ,  propose and implement solutions to the problems that traders face on a daily basis .  the role involves all of the following   -  incident & problem management  -  change management  -  release management  -  knowledge management  ( through wiki and training sessions )   -  alert management  ( through the development of bespoke application monitoring )   - requisite as the clients are traders and thus expect a premium level of service and understanding of the business ,  products and markets  -  together with a good appreciation of a trader mindset .   -  zappos . com ,  inc .  is looking for a non - trade purchasing college intern !   why join us ?  our unique culture has made zappos . com ,  inc .  and its subsidiaries one of fortune’s 100 best companies to work for five years straight .  find out why  http  /  / money . cnn . com .  .  .   why else .  .  .  .   want more ?  summer interns may qualify for corporate housing assistance ,  free food and drinks on our campus ,  social events throughout the internship ,  and a 40 percent off discount on zappos . com !   if you are interested ,  please go to internships . zappos . com and apply directly to the position there !   who are we ?   non - inventory purchasing is an essential part of zappos finance .  without us ,  no one would be able to buy anything ,  and none of our bills would get paid .  no ,  for real ,  we support the drive for spend optimization and we create efficiencies in established processes like it ain t no thang .  we also dress up as pioneers and make forts out of the couches in the break room ,  but that s not important right now .   we work very closely with financial planning and analysis ,  the sweethearts in accounts payable ,  that money - loving cohort in treasury ,  and our tough - as - nails legal department .  we interact with 78 percent of the other cost centers in zappos like every single day .  or maybe we don t ,  maybe it is only 77percent .  only one way to find out  go ahead and apply .   what will you do ?   this person will focus on process improvements  updating documentation and supporting the drive for spend optimization and efficiency creation .  even though this is an internship position ,  you will be challenged to grow professionally by mastering quantitative analysis and documentation skills with the guidance of members of the purchasing team .  you will become a subject matter expert in your assigned functional areas .  you will first use your prowess to assist with tasks and develop documentation ,  and then the experience will culminate with you providing actionable ,  insightful analysis .   the cliffsnotes      assist with the full range of supply chain activities ,  starting at the vetting process   assist with vendor maintenance and set up   excel wizardry a must   wiki updates ,  and updating current process documentation   price comparison   contract finalization   entering po requests   expense report assistance   enhance team and culture   be results and team oriented and foster that culture with others   live the zappos values daily and wow coworkers ,  supervisors ,  external contacts ,  etc .  with a focus on doing more with less   build positive working relationships with internal customers   assist with the qa of new reporting and purchasing tools  are you a match ?     finance ,  accounting ,  economics ,  or related major preferred ,  or if you just have a strong passion and knowledge of accounting / finance ,  we are okay with that too !    exceptional communication and interpersonal skills with a customer service orientation   organized ,  detail oriented ,  and ability to multitask   understanding of microsoft office suite ,  particularly outlook ,  and especially excel   normal working business hours are monday through friday 8 30 a . m .  to 5 30 p . m .    must be willing to relocate to las vegas ,  nv for the summer of 2014  ( did we mention we have some sweet housing lined up ? will basis ,  which means that   ( a )  my employment and compensation are not guaranteed for any definite period ,  and can be terminated ,  with or without cause ,  and with or without notice ,  by either the company or myself ,  and  ( b )  there is no written or oral agreement or representation that can alter my at - will status except an individual written agreement signed by the chief executive officer of bloomberg .  i agree that the information on this application  ( and accompanying documents ,  if any )  is true and complete to the best of my knowledge .  i am responsible for ensuring that the information i submit is accurate and up - to - date .  i may review or update my personal information at any time using this site or by entering a request via careers -  feedback  .  i also agree that any misstatement ,  false information ,  or omission deemed significant by bloomberg may disqualify me from consideration ,  and / or may be reason for discharge if discovered after an offer of employment has been extended to me .  i agree that i am not party to any agreement ,  or subject to any legal obligation ,  that would in any way restrict me ,  or interfere with me from fully performing the requirements of the job for which i am applying ,  and that i must disclose to the company any such agreement or obligation before the company considers my application .  i understand that if i am selected to proceed with the application process ,  i may be given or obtain access to non - public information that the company considers to be of a confidential ,  proprietary ,  or trade secret nature  (   confidential information   )  .  i agree that i will not directly or indirectly disclose the confidential information to any third party ,  and that i will not use the confidential information for my own benefit or for the benefit of any third party .  in addition ,  i agree that if i am offered employment at bloomberg ,  that such offer ,  and continued employment ,  is contingent on the results of a reference check and background investigation .  i understand that the company is an equal employment opportunity / affirmative action employer ,  and that the application process will be conducted in accord with applicable eeo / affirmative action requirements where the relevant position is located .  i understand and agree that bloomberg may use any personal information submitted in my application for the purpose of considering my suitability for employment ,  as well as for general statistical analysis and reporting purposes ,  including candidate activity and demographic reports .  bloomberg will process my information in compliance with applicable laws on privacy and data protection .  i agree that if bloomberg does not employ me at this time ,  bloomberg may retain and use the information that it obtains as part of the application process to consider my application later if a suitable position becomes available and ,  if appropriate ,  to refer back to this application if i apply again .  if at any time i no longer want bloomberg to consider my application for employment ,  i understand i must enter a request via careers -  feedback ,  in which case the information will be stored securely for no more than one year from the date of notification ,  and access to it will only be made to the extent necessary for legal and regulatory purposes .  i understand that bloomberg is a global company and that it will process my information on its servers in the united states of america .  bloomberg is committed to compliance with its privacy obligations and for that reason will apply the safe harbor privacy policy ,  to the extent applicable ,  when processing my information on its us servers .  i further agree that if i am applying for a position outside the eea and us ,  bloomberg may also process my information on its servers in the country in which the relevant position is located and comply with the privacy legislation in that country .  i understand my information may be disclosed to law enforcement ,  regulatory or other government agencies ,  or third parties where required and where necessary to comply with legal or regulatory obligations or requests .  by continuing with this application ,  i voluntarily consent to the above terms ,  and recognize that my agreement to these terms is legally binding and enforceable to the same extent as if i had signed my name .  by clicking the   apply now   button below you agree to the terms of the above legal statement .

 regardless of college major or professional experience ,  nearly 100% of our full - time employees start out in our management training program .  this allows everyone to learn our business from the ground up and understand how they play a significant role in seeing it succeed .   once you ve completed your initial orientation and training ,  you ll be assigned to a branch office in your home area and the hands - on training begins .  you ll learn valuable business skills from capable mentors who were once in your shoes .  nearly 100% of all our managers and corporate executives started out as management trainees .   during your first year ,  you will actively participate in everything from sales and marketing and customer service to operations and finance .  as you progress ,  you will be tested and evaluated to determine your proficiency in these areas .  successful completion of these tests and evaluations will result in rewards ,  pay increases and the opportunity for continued promotions .   as you progress ,  increasingly more opportunities will become available to you .  you can choose ,  as most people do ,  to continue your rewarding ascent within our rental operations managerial track or you can explore one of many other exciting options including fleet management ,  human resources ,  car sales ,  accounting ,  marketing and more .    as a management trainee ,  you are empowered to make business decisions that greatly affect your career as well as the bottom line .  you ll gain responsibility for developing new business and maintaining current relationships .  you ll be responsible for understanding cost control ,  reading your branch s p&l statement and understanding what it takes to run a profitable business .  you will also learn how to deliver superior customer service .  we will teach you how to effectively communicate ,  influence and interact with all types of customers ,  vendors and co - workers .  you ll learn proper sales techniques to problem solving and conflict management .  those skills will provide you with the opportunity to market to local business partners and build solid ,  long - lasting relationships with key business decision - makers .  in your development to become a successful manager at enterprise ,  you ll learn how to mentor ,  train ,  develop ,  manage and promote a staff of your own .      bachelor s degree required .    previous experience in sales ,  customer service ,  or management preferred .    must have a valid driver s license with no more than 2 moving violations on driving record in the last 3 years   no drug or alcohol convictions on driving record within the past 5 years .    must be at least 18 years old .    must be authorized to work in the united states and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future .

leading analytics and advisory services ,  highly specialized product knowledge and trading relationships with reinsurance markets around the world .  headquartered in new york city ,  guy carpenter has more than 2 , 300 employees in more than 50 locations worldwide .   the junior investment banking professional will play a critical role on the gc securities advisory team .  the banker s responsibilities include     gathering and synthesizing financial and operating information about companies and industries   analyzing detailed corporate and financial information   developing and maintaining complex financial models   performing various financial analyses ,  including valuations and merger consequences   developing marketing materials and delivering sections of client presentations .    preparing presentations and other materials for both internal and external clients   participating in the due diligence process and execution of financings and m&a transactions .    managing several projects at once and working effectively as an individual and as part of a team .    providing oversight and guidance to analysts  work .   qualifications    minimum two years of investment banking ,  corporate development or related experience   bachelors degree required with a minimum gpa 3 . 2   mba degree preferred   proficiency with excel ,  word and powerpoint   2 years experience of execution capabilities  ( i . e .  ,  ability to execute m&a and capital raising processes )    must have basic understanding of  ( re ) insurance business and competitive landscape   demonstrate financial modeling skills ,  strong quantitative  /  analytical skills   ability to manage and prioritize competing requests from different areas of the business   strategic and creative thinking with excellent written and oral communication skills   assertiveness and willingness to take initiative   excellent attention to detail and quality orientation   ability to work on cross -
