 regardless of college major or professional experience ,  nearly 100% of our full - time employees start out in our management training program .  this allows everyone to learn our business from the ground up and understand how they play a significant role in seeing it succeed .   once you ve completed your initial orientation and training ,  you ll be assigned to a branch office in your home area and the hands - on training begins .  you ll learn valuable business skills from capable mentors who were once in your shoes .  nearly 100% of all our managers and corporate executives started out as management trainees .   during your first year ,  you will actively participate in everything from sales and marketing and customer service to operations and finance .  as you progress ,  you will be tested and evaluated to determine your proficiency in these areas .  successful completion of these tests and evaluations will result in rewards ,  pay increases and the opportunity for continued promotions .   as you progress ,  increasingly more opportunities will become available to you .  you can choose ,  as most people do ,  to continue your rewarding ascent within our rental operations managerial track or you can explore one of many other exciting options including fleet management ,  human resources ,  car sales ,  accounting ,  marketing and more .    as a management trainee ,  you are empowered to make business decisions that greatly affect your career as well as the bottom line .  you ll gain responsibility for developing new business and maintaining current relationships .  you ll be responsible for understanding cost control ,  reading your branch s p&l statement and understanding what it takes to run a profitable business .  you will also learn how to deliver superior customer service .  we will teach you how to effectively communicate ,  influence and interact with all types of customers ,  vendors and co - workers .  you ll learn proper sales techniques to problem solving and conflict management .  those skills will provide you with the opportunity to market to local business partners and build solid ,  long - lasting relationships with key business decision - makers .  in your development to become a successful manager at enterprise ,  you ll learn how to mentor ,  train ,  develop ,  manage and promote a staff of your own .      bachelor s degree required .    previous experience in sales ,  customer service ,  or management .    must have a valid driver s license with no more than 2 moving violations on driving record in the last 3 years   no drug or alcohol convictions on driving record within the past 5 years .    must be at least 18 years old .    must be authorized to work in the united states and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future .

oriented role that involves creating and design of marketing material that is in - line with the imri’s brand .  this is a part - time position .  the intern will be responsible for supporting all graphic design elements of the organization’s marketing collateral ,  and should be able to provide a degree of real - world graphic design / technical support to the marketing material aimed at supporting and developing our businesses .  primary responsibilities  · development and creation of presentations and layouts based on the imri’s brand · design presentations ,  logos ,  icons ,  event graphics / collateral ,  info graphics ,  web based - elements ,  and internal communication collateral · determine hierarchy ,  size and arrangement of copy and graphics ,  select style and size of type ,  and arrange layouts based on available space and aesthetic design concepts · ensure the accuracy of all information contained in created file · ensure consistent implementation of all imri’s branded elements into marketing materials · other duties as assigned requirements · bachelor’s degree in graphic design ,  marketing ,  advertising ,  communications ,  journalism or related field · portfolio and work samples demonstrating proven experience in designing marketing collateral .  · 1 - 2 years of experience as a graphic designer · understanding how front - end web development works  ( e . g .  css ,  html ,  javascript )  · creative problem solving skills · amazing sense of typography ,  color ,  layout ,  and hierarchy · experience in producing final files ready for press or web · ability to translate existing designs in a variety of media · working knowledge of graphic design software on a mac - based platform ,  specifically adobe indesign ,  adobe cs6 , illustrator ,  photoshop and ms office suite · knowledge of the latest graphic design / marketing and communication trends and techniques “imri is an equal employment opportunity / affirmative action employer that provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race ,  color ,  religion ,  sex ,  national origin ,  ancestry ,  age ,  disability ,  marital status ,  veteran status ,  or sexual orientation in accordance with applicable federal ,  state ,  and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which imri has facilities .  this policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment ,  including but not limited to ,  employment ,  recruitment ,  selection ,  compensation ,  benefits ,  training ,  promotions ,  demotions ,  layoffs ,  terminations ,  and all other terms and conditions of employment . ”     
 headquartered in san diego ,  california ,  usa ,  solar turbines incorporated ,  a subsidiary of caterpillar inc .  ,  is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of industrial gas turbines ,  with more than 14 , 400 units and over 1 . 9 billion operating hours in 98 countries .   products from solar turbines play an important role in the development of oil ,  natural gas and power generation projects around the world .  solar turbines’ products include gas turbine engines  ( rated from 1590 to 30 , 000 horsepower )  ,  gas compressors ,  and gas turbine - powered compressor sets ,  mechanical - drive packages and generator sets  ( ranging from 1 . 1 to 22 megawatts )  .   solar’s customers put the company’s products to work in many areas including production ,  processing and pipeline transmission of natural gas and crude oil and generation of electricity and thermal energy for processing applications ,  such as manufacturing chemicals ,  pharmaceuticals ,  and food products .   solar’s foundation is people and solar’s culture is one where individual contributions are valued ,  diversity in the workplace is encouraged ,  and safety is emphasized in all aspects of the business .  solar turbines is comprised of a dedicated and multi - talented workforce of more than 7 , 500 employees with decades of experience working as a global team .   we currently have a career opportunity for a internship  -  controls design engineer at our kearny mesa facility in san diego .   job description   customer services package refurbishment and upgrades  ( pr&u )  engineering provides engineered solutions in support of the aftermarket business .  this position is responsible for the control system design of package upgrades and retrofits .  the candidate will be thorough ,  organized ,  and detail oriented ,  and able to convey concepts and thoughts in a concise manner .   the incumbent must be able to independently gather and analyze relevant data and define project issues in engineering terms .  the ability to work in a fast paced ,  teaming environment  capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously ,  while meeting various deadlines and project schedule commitments is also needed .   excellent oral and written communication skills are needed to ensure that other project team members are kept informed regarding problems and issues for projects in work .   strong interpersonal ,  good judgment ,  and teaming skills are also needed .   qualifications   the position works with various engineering ,  manufacturing ,  and field installation personnel to ensure that project designs are high quality ,  safe ,  and cost - effective while meeting customer commitments by providing accurate and timely control system designs ,  documentation and software .  interfaces extensively and resolves problems with other engineering disciplines and production to ensure incorporation of all required package design criteria .   works interactively with installation and commissioning personnel to ensure customer downtime is minimized during project execution .  must be able to interpret engineering drawings and apply this information to create overall package control system design .  sales orders are executed under the direction of customer services project management in conjunction with an interdisciplinary team .  the successful candidate is a college student working towards a bachelor of science degree in engineering .   applicants must be currently eligible to work in the united states .   for information on employment eligibility in the united states ,  please visit the u . s .  immigration services website .   solar turbines offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical ,  dental ,  life insurance ,  vacation ,  401k ,  incentive bonus ,  tuition reimbursement and professional development / advancement opportunities .   solar turbines is an equal opportunity employer .   solar turbines conducts drug screens and background checks .   please visit our website www . solarturbines . com for more information about our company .

 position summary  support of the following engineering functions  mechanical ,  manufacturing ,  and electrical .  exposure to and project participation in many functional areas .  expand and enhance basic knowledge in conjunction with academic subjects of study .  interact with supervisors ,  project leaders ,  engineers ,  technicians ,  and those with skilled trades on a daily basis . job responsibilities  1 .  mechanical engineering  -  support mechanical engineering staffs by performing basic and repetitive engineering assignments in the design ,  development ,  and production of high - volume engines and end - products .  participate in a variety of rotational assignments in functional areas  i . e .  ,  product test ,  design and development ,  machine shop ,  component and technology research ,  application engineering ,  materials ,  and manufacturing .  assignments draw upon knowledge of thermo - dynamics ,  heat transfer ,  fluid dynamics ,  strength of materials ,  material science ,  machine elements ,  and manufacturing . 2 .  electrical engineering  -  support electrical engineering staffs by performing basic and repetitive engineering assignments in the design of product and in support of product development toward production of high - volume engine -  and end - product .  participate in a variety of rotational assignments in functional areas  i . e .  ,  testing ,  applications ,  manufacturing  ( automation and plc programming )  ,  electrical design ,  electro - mechanical devices ,  instrumentation  ( data acquisition and dyno control )  ,  and microprocessors .  assignments will draw upon knowledge of electronics ,  hardware and software ,  wiring ,  circuit board design ,  programming  ( visual basic ,  c++ )  ,  embedded systems training ,  testing and recording of data . 3 .  manufacturing engineering  -  support manufacturing engineering staffs by performing basic and repetitive engineering assignments using standard procedures in implementing production / processing methods and controls to meet quality standards in the most cost efficient manner .  participate in a variety of assignments in functional areas  i . e .  ,  tooling ,  diecast ,  stamping ,  quality ,  assembly ,  manufacturing development ,  and coatings .  assignments will draw upon knowledge of thermo - dynamics ,  heat transfer ,  fluid dynamics ,  strength of materials ,  material science ,  machine elements ,  and manufacturing .  observe and learn manufacturing and engineering methods to permit manufacture by the most favorable methods  ( dfm )  . engineering  · perform other duties and responsibilities as requested or required · perform specific and limited portions of less complex assignments for higher - level engineerscompetenciesjob skills requirements  1 .  mechanical engineering  -  students should be mechanically inclined and have an interest in internal combustion engines or other briggs & stratton products and equipment2 .  electrical engineering  - growing private company in central texas .  also in 2012 ,  kinnser was named among austin s top workplaces .  in 2011 and 2010 ,  kinnser was recognized in inc magazine’s list of the 500 fastest growing private companies in the united states and was among the top 50 fastest growing software companies .  we have clients in 22 states and the us virgin islands .  based in south austin ,  kinnser offers competitive compensation ,  excellent health and employer matched retirement benefits ,  paid time off and a casual and progressive work environment .  kinnser software values individuality and is an equal opportunity employer .  about the kinnser intern program  kinnser interns  (   kinterns   )  enjoy challenging project work in a fun and collaborative environment that directly benefits the company and its customers .  interns can expect regular one - on - one interaction with department and company leadership ,  along with opportunities to plan and participate in social and volunteer activities .  interns make up the kinnser intern council which meets weekly to discuss projects ,  share ideas ,  and learn from q&a with special guests / executives .

 overall function   reporting to the specialty fulfillment manager ,  the dsd fulfillment clerk accurately fulfills dsd and wholesale coffee orders and assists retail fulfillment with order fulfillment as necessary .  distribute peet s pos supplies in an organized ,  timely and efficient manner ,  and maintaining excellent relationships with the shipping and receiving department .   essential responsibilities     •   maintain order fulfillment in an accurate and sensible manner to avoid damage .    •   report damages and shortages to the fulfillment manager and coordinator .    •   fill hardware supply orders and distribute to stores in a timely and accurate manner .        check the open request reports throughout the day and accommodate emergency requests promptly .        maintain hardware and supply areas in a clean ,  orderly and safe manner .   follow health ,  gmp and safety guidelines .         assist other warehouse employees as needed and as per the request of the plant manager and retail fulfillment supervisors .   qualifications     ability to read and follow written instructions accurately .    manual dexterity and ability to comfortably lift a minimum of 50 pounds .    orientation towards teamwork and an ability to work effectively with a group of people .    accuracy ,  thoroughness ,  reliability ,  and flexibility .    attention to detail and the ability to uphold standards .    self - directed ,  and able to work with minimal supervision .    basic computer skills .    fork lift certifiable and ability to follow strict safety guidelines .      
 about craft coffee we are dedicated to bringing our customers unique coffee experiences .  coffee is an everday ritual .  we aim to make each coffee moment a little more special .  every month ,  our expert panel blindly evaluates 50+ coffees .  from those ,  we select just three that rise to the level of a craft coffee .  we ship our coffee tasting boxes to thousands of customers in all 50 states and dozens of countries .  we re backed by a group of global ,  top - tier investors .  our partners include brands like ted and wired .  food republic regularly includes us in their coffee power rankings .  imbibe magazine called us one of the top coffee companies to watch in 2013 .  we ve been featured in the wall street journal ,  tasting table ,  the next web ,  wired ,  sprudge ,  saveur ,  martha stewart s everyday food ,  bon appetit ,  brink magazine ,  fast company ,  serious eats ,  new york magazine ,  esquire ,  imbibe and a whole lot more .  why you should intern here here s the thing  companies like ours don t typically have entry level positions available because we have limited resources and we need every hire to add very significant value .  you ll hear that a lot if you re looking for

 our internships play an integral role in the success of enterprise and are a comprehensive introduction to our management training program .  for a college student ,  real - world professional business experience can put you above the rest when you enter the job market .   it s business 101 on 10 cups of coffee  our interns go at a highly energized pace .  from day one as a paid intern with enterprise ,  you ll learn what it takes to run a successful business and acquire highly marketable skills and experience pertaining to every aspect of operating a business .  and it s learning by doing ,  not by getting coffee or filing all day .  our college interns take on the same challenges as our first and second year full - time professionals .  it s a team - based environment where the enterprise employees are supportive and fun to work with .    when you join our management internship program ,  you ll acquire highly marketable skills and experience pertaining to every aspect of running a successful business .  you ll soon discover that every day is different because it is filled with so many new ,  exciting ,  rewarding and often unexpected challenges .  there is one consistent aspect ,  however  -  everyday ,  you ll learn more about sales / marketing ,  customer service ,  business management ,  and administrative skills than you ever thought possible .   at enterprise ,  you won t be a glorified gopher getting coffee or filing all day .  our interns go at the same energized pace and take on the same challenges and responsibilities as our management trainees .   not only is it a paid internship program ,  but interns may also be eligible for performance incentives and employee referral rewards .  the business training you ll receive will be an amazing jumpstart to your career .      must be a rising junior or senior enrolled full time in a bachelor s degree program for the up coming semester in a college or university .    must have 6 months of sales ,  customer service ,  marketing or management experience .    will consider leadership experience in organizations / clubs ,  volunteer work / community service or military in lieu of the work experience .    will consider experience as a student athlete in lieu of the work experience .     must have a valid driver s license with no more than 3 moving violations and / or at fault accidents in the past 3 years .    no drug or alcohol related conviction on your record in the past 5 years  ( i . e .  ,  dui ,  dwi )    must be authorized to work in the united states and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future .

companies’ premium tobacco brands include marlboro ,  copenhagen ,  skoal and black & mild .  altria also owns ste .  michelle wine estates ,  one of the country’s top premium wine producers and consumers with superior branded products .   we are currently seeking a sales undergraduate intern to join our field sales force in bedminster ,  nj .   as a sales undergraduate sales intern ,  you market events and post market close events be able to work hands on with tight deadlines gain thorough industry knowledge quickly and effectively interact with other operating units .  provide effective maker / checker function to ensure data quality and accuracy ensure adherence to all audit policies and procedures .   provide sit ,  uat testing with strategic technology rollouts expected to work staggered shifts  ( 7am est – 7pm est )  to support pre - market ,  market close ,  regulatory reporting and other events pertained to emea and nam operations coordinate with global coders in other regions to resolve issue understand global procedures to support other markets during off hours  qualifications  qualifications minimum requirements     strong organization skills with an excellent attention to detail   ability to focus on high quality work while under pressure   advanced knowledge of ms office suite ,  including proficiency in excel   strong teamwork skills in a small local setting ,  as well as across different geographic locations   must possess good communication skills with the ability to be assertive  preferred requirements     familiarity with a wide array of financial product types   knowledge and familiarity with financial product data vendors  ( bloomberg ,  reuters ,  s&p ,  telekurs ,  etc )   job id  13051280

 disney professional internships  forecasting and planning internship  company overview  since its opening in 1955 ,  the disneyland® resort in anaheim ,  california has welcomed guests of all ages from around the globe .  the disneyland resort features two spectacular theme parks – disneyland  ( the original disney theme park )  and disney california adventure park – plus the downtown disney district comprised of unique dining ,  entertainment and shopping experiences .  the resort’s three hotels are the luxurious disney’s grand californian hotel & spa  the magical disneyland hotel and disney’s paradise pier hotel with its   day - at - the - beach   fun .   since its opening in 1971 ,  the walt disney world resort near orlando ,  fl has grown to feature four theme parks – the magic kingdom® park ,  epcot® ,  disney’s hollywood studios® ,  and disney’s animal kingdom® theme park .  in addition ,  more than 20 themed resort hotels ,  two water parks ,  and the downtown disney® area ,  a daytime and nighttime entertainment complex ,  are part of the walt disney world resort .    the forecasting and planning teams are responsible for supporting the tactical and strategic objectives of the organization by providing daily ,  weekly ,  and annual operational and financial forecasts and plans of attendance / admissions revenue ,  rooms / rooms revenue ,  f&b revenue ,  merchandise revenue ,  and other driver - related revenue for both the walt disney world and disneyland resorts .   intern assignments include ,  but are not limited to     supporting the forecasting and planning processes by consolidating inputs from multiple functional areas ,  such as operations ,  finance ,  pricing ,  revenue management ,  sales ,  marketing ,  business development ,  etc .     analyzing large quantities of historical data to better understand guest behavior and influence forecasts ,  plans ,  and strategic growth initiatives by identifying trends ,  patterns ,  and irregularities in key business metrics    building complex financial spreadsheet models / analysis to drive business decisions for multiple lines of business at wdw and dlr    identifying and  headquartered in san diego ,  california ,  usa ,  solar turbines incorporated ,  a subsidiary of caterpillar inc .  ,  is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of industrial gas turbines ,  with more than 14 , 400 units and over 1 . 9 billion operating hours in 98 countries .   products from solar turbines play an important role in the development of oil ,  natural gas and power generation projects around the world .  solar turbines’ products include gas turbine engines  ( rated from 1590 to 30 , 000 horsepower )  ,  gas compressors ,  and gas turbine - powered compressor sets ,  mechanical - drive packages and generator sets  ( ranging from 1 . 1 to 22 megawatts )  .   solar’s customers put the company’s products to work in many areas including production ,  processing and pipeline transmission of natural gas and crude oil and generation of electricity and thermal energy for processing applications ,  such as manufacturing chemicals ,  pharmaceuticals ,  and food products .   solar’s foundation is people and solar’s culture is one where individual contributions are valued ,  diversity in the workplace is encouraged ,  and safety is emphasized in all aspects of the business .  solar turbines is comprised of a dedicated and multi - talented workforce of more than 7 , 500 employees with decades of experience working as a global team .   we currently have a career opportunity for a internship  -  controls design engineer at our kearny mesa facility in san diego .   job description   customer services package refurbishment and upgrades  ( pr&u )  engineering provides engineered solutions in support of the aftermarket business .  this position is responsible for the control system design of package upgrades and retrofits .  the candidate will be thorough ,  organized ,  and detail oriented ,  and able to convey concepts and thoughts in a concise manner .   the incumbent must be able to independently gather and analyze relevant data and define project issues in engineering terms .  the ability to work in a fast paced ,  teaming environment  capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously ,  while meeting various deadlines and project schedule commitments is also needed .   excellent oral and written communication skills are needed to ensure that other project team members are kept informed regarding problems and issues for projects in work .   strong interpersonal ,  good judgment ,  and teaming skills are also needed .   qualifications   the position works with various engineering ,  manufacturing ,  and field installation personnel to ensure that project designs are high quality ,  safe ,  and cost - effective while meeting customer commitments by providing accurate and timely control system designs ,  documentation and software .  interfaces extensively and resolves problems with other engineering disciplines and production to ensure incorporation of all required package design criteria .   works interactively with installation and commissioning personnel to ensure customer downtime is minimized during project execution .  must be able to interpret engineering drawings and apply this information to create overall package control system design .  sales orders are executed under the direction of customer services project management in conjunction with an interdisciplinary team .  the successful candidate is a college student working towards a bachelor of science degree in engineering .   applicants must be currently eligible to work in the united states .   for information on employment eligibility in the united states ,  please visit the u . s .  immigration services website .   solar turbines offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical ,  dental ,  life insurance ,  vacation ,  401k ,  incentive bonus ,  tuition reimbursement and professional development / advancement opportunities .   solar turbines is an equal opportunity employer .   solar turbines conducts drug screens and background checks .   please visit our website www . solarturbines . com for more information about our company .

 i m looking for continuing administrative virtual assistant work .  our family operates over 30 fast food restaurants across several companies .  we also have personal investments that need daily review .  we have reached the size where we want to formalize and outsource routine business activity .  we d like to do this by finding a company that could do administrative work to simplify our management and time .  none of the work that needs to be automated and outsourced is well documented and is not being done with any formally process today .  we ll begin the process of structuring these tasks and then giving them to the va .  we d expect that once we found a company we could work with ,  the weekly hours would be more than 30 .  the job would require that some tasks get done each business day without exception for holidays or any other reason .  also some tasks would be time sensitive on wednesdays 8am to 3pm east coast usa time .  the plan is to identify a supplier that could do this work at a price we can afford and try the service out .  we would gradually grow the hours over a few months time as website functions are developed and implemented .  if the relationship works ,  the work could continue for an undetermined number of years .  we are more interested in finding a company providing services than an individual to make sure we can have long term continuity and have the full coverage we need .  we are not sure that an individual could be available as much as we need long term .  if you are interested in this project ,  i d like a range of hourly costs for the types of administrative services shown below .  examples of administrative things we need done  expense coding spreadsheet development and related data entry data entry into web  join a start - up technology company in the restaurant industry to help make a positive difference in the food community !  this internship will give you the opportunity to work as a key contributor in designing and developing our editorial section ,  trying new restaurants ,  helping to create our newsletter content ,  as well as interviewing chefs and industry leaders .  this is a great opportunity to take initiative ,  provide input ,  and make a positive impact on small business owners and food lovers across the world !  also a great resume builder to show what you can do while you do what you love !  about food mafia  what started as a tongue - in - cheek reference to a mock crime syndicate became the inspiration for the exclusive restaurant recommendation site foodmafia . com .  referring to the process that founder stacy johnson went through with her friends to try great ,  unique restaurants ,  the reference blossomed into a business idea that took off .  realizing that the best recommendations were always from friends or trusted ,  credible sources that had similar tastes ,  stacy wanted to help others quickly find a great dining experience but without all the negative ,  anonymous reviews .  food mafia has made this process easy and fun !  we have done the dirty work for you .  with food mafia ,  you no longer have to do research and filter through negative ,  anonymous reviews to find trusted restaurant recommendations .  we have invited our favorite diners ,  chefs ,  and industry professionals from around the world to join together to share their favorite restaurants .  from 24 course meals to food stands ,  we have members that truly share your taste in food .  use foodmafia . com to find your next great dining experience by choosing a city and running a search .  from tracking your favorite restaurant to sharing and receiving customized recommendations ,  you can make food mafia work for you without having to do any of the hard ,  dirty work .  just like the mafia ,  our site is closely monitored and controlled .  our member community is strong across the united states ,  with a presence in large cities such as chicago ,  los angeles ,  new york ,  and san francisco .  we are expanding quickly across the globe ,  with members committed to finding and sharing great and unique dining experiences .  what makes food mafia unique  unlike other restaurant review sites ,  our approved members are made up of food lovers ,  celebrity chefs ,  and industry professionals .  see what top chefs and restaurateurs are saying about food mafia  http  /  / www . foodmafia . com .  .  .

 at the fresh market ,  we believe it s the small things that make the biggest difference  a perfect flower .  a fresh cup of coffee .  a friendly employee who goes beyond the call of duty .   these are the things that change our mood and our day .   these are the things we remember .   as a produce clerk with the fresh market you will be responsible for working closely with store manager ,  assistant store managers ,  and produce manager in order to create the fresh market environment and ensure the success of the store and department through excellent customer service and a demonstrated passion for food .   the produce clerk will demonstrate an overall knowledge of programs and operations to include ,  but not limited to ,  all produce department products .   the friends of the fresh market come to our stores for more than just wonderful food .   our produce clerk will be passionately dedicated and personally invested in creating a warm and safe environment for our customers and store employees .   the fresh market produce clerk will be responsible for making our unique experience come alive in an atmosphere that fosters genuine camaraderie and a heartfelt sense of belonging .   join the fresh market ,  and you ll work for a company that s dedicated to making positive ,  lasting impressions .   on our customers ,  and on our employees .   a company that cares just as much about the little things as we do about the big ones .   because after all ,  it s the experience that matters .   qualifications  the fresh market prefers previous experience in the food ,  grocery ,  produce ,  or retail industry .  the fresh market requires basic math skills .   candidates should be highly motivated with a sense of urgency and the ability to work in a fast - paced environment at all times with all levels of employees .   demonstrated excellent people skills are required for all positions within the fresh market .   the job requires standing ,  walking ,  bending ,  climbing throughout the entire work day and the ability to lift ,  stack and maneuver objects .   weekend ,  evening and holiday work will be required in the position .  minimum age for employment is 18 .   job produce clerk  primary location us - 72 inches .  specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision ,  color ,  and depth perception .   work environment .  the work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the essential functions of this job .  reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions .  while performing the duties of this job ,  the associate constantly works in a cool environment with an average temperature range of 55 - 60 degrees fahrenheit and is frequently exposed to wet and / or humid conditions and moving mechanical parts .  the associate is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles ,  toxic or caustic chemicals ,  and is frequently exposed to cold .  the noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud .

 provides superior customer service .  orders ,  stocks ,  rotates and maintains produce in accordance with company standards regarding merchandise presentation ,  safety ,  sanitation ,  service and suggestive selling .  significant amount of time spent in trimming ,  washing and preparing product for placement in the display cases .  additional duties as needed .      
 will be working with produce analysis - answering phones  -  connecting to inner company staff ,  entering data in computer on longevity of produce  -  per species working with word ,  generating invoices ,  contact with farmers for availability .      
 with a focus on providing superior customer service ,  the produce clerk provides customers with product knowledge and the freshest and best quality produce ,  replenishing and rotating merchandise ,  filling refrigerated and non - refrigerated cases ,  and building colorful and attractive displays .   some job responsibilities include     maintaining a positive and friendly attitude towards customers and the team .    engaging with customers through smiles and greetings ,  offering product information ,  providing selling suggestions and active sampling and always giving a genuine thank you .    unloading trailers ,  receiving merchandise verifying orders ,  breaking down produce loads ,  positioning cases of product in the produce warehouse or walk - in cooler .    understanding proper product trimming ,  rotation ,  culling ,  crisping and watering techniques and procedures ,  ensuring product attractiveness and shelf life .    building attractive displays of produce ,  while maintaining proper product inventory levels .    understanding the importance of monitoring product pricing ,  signage ,  and placement and the proper use of product shelf tags and signage .    keeping clean neat and orderly work areas ,  including a well swept produce department .    attentively stocking dated perishable products ,  rotating them as necessary to ensure quality and safety .   performs other duties as needed or assigned by management .  must be at least 18 yearsold .    include     a friendly and positive attitude towards customers and team members .    a desire to greet ,  engage and sincerely thank the customer   an outstanding work ethic and a desire to constantly improve one’s work performance .    ability to work well with others ,  helping to support each team member’s effort to succeed .    ability to be flexible ,  adapting to new jobs ,  schedules ,  team members ,  programs ,  policies and procedures .    ability to learn quickly and a desire to learn and do more .    ability to think through one’s decisions ,  solving problems and coming up with solutions .    ability to     remain helpful ,  tactful and courteous at all times .    work quickly and efficiently ,  sometimes with little direction ,  to accomplish assigned duties .    add ,  subtract ,  divide ,  multiply and perform other basic business math calculations .    read upc codes ,  product labels ,  shelf signage ,  business forms ,  and posted company policies / procedures .    identify and communicate the place of origin ,  taste and uses of a wide variety of fruits ,  vegetables and other produce products .    learn the uses and cooking methods of fruits ,  vegetables and produce products merchandised .    be dexterous enough with hands and fingers so as to be able to fill and rotate products quickly and use necessary equipment ,  including knives ,  wrappers and scales .    communicate openly and professionally through appropriate body language ,  facial expressions and speech ,  also communicating in writing when necessary .    listen to and understand verbal and non - verbal communication of customers and fellow members .    stand for long periods of time ,  bend and twist ,  and frequently lift and / or maneuver merchandise and supplies weighing 30 – 40 lbs .  .    lift and maneuver up to 100 lbs and break down large and very heavy pallet loads of produce cases ,  boxes and bags .    operate manual and electric pallet jacks .    often work in walk - in refrigerated coolers .    work with all sorts of vegetables and fruits ,  spices ,  nuts ,  flavorings ,  sauces and oils .

to our core values of customers ,  competition ,  family ,  freshness ,  and safety & health .  meijer s midwest geography includes corporate offices in grand rapids ,  michigan ,  and stores ,  distribution centers ,  and manufacturing facilities throughout michigan ,  indiana ,  illinois ,  ohio ,  and kentucky .   currently ,  meijer is looking for a food clerk .  the individual selected for this position will be responsible for delivering remarkable customer service by providing customers with exceptional product knowledge ,  efficient service and a friendly attitude .  this entry level team member position will be exposed to a variety of retail tasks related to product ,  customer service and merchandising .   key responsibilities include     possessing a sense of urgency and comfort level to be able to work in a fast paced environment   building rapport with customers   displaying a friendly and outgoing attitude that is shown through good eye contact and body language a fast paced environment   desire to work with customers on a consistent basis   ability to lift ,  carry ,  push ,  pull ,  bend and twist while handling product   ability to stand for long periods of time  thank you for your interest in this position .  there may not be current openings for this position at this time .  by submitting an application to this position ,  you are expressing interest should an opening become available in the future .  our recruiters routinely review available applications as openings become available .

 instructional support assistant  ( job id 3449 )  full - time family consumer sciences  about the division the department of family & consumer sciences is inspired by the belief that a supportive ,  challenging learning environment is a foundation for the personal ,  intellectual and professional development of our students ,  faculty and staff .  family & consumer sciences  ( fcs )  encompasses the study of relationships among people and their personal environments ,  focusing on the impact of physical ,  biological ,  and social environments on human behavior and development .   major duties under general supervision ,  the instructional support assistant assists the faculty in the department of family and consumer sciences  ( fcs )  with the daily operations of the interior design and apparel laboratories and the interior design resource library  secures and maintains instructional and research needs / materials  provides maintenance and general repair of equipment  coordinates and oversees weekly open hours in labs  assists faculty ,  physical plant management  ( ppm )  and outside vendors to maintain equipment in good working order  provides training to faculty and assists the health and human development inventory personnel and asset management with inventory of interior design and apparel equipment  maintains the daily department laptop checkout schedule  monitors ,  assigns ,  and distributes copier codes to department personnel  serves as the webmaster for the fcs ,  didactic program in dietetics  ( dpd )  and dietetics internship  ( di )  websites  assists with general fcs web maintenance  serves as department photographer at fcs events for the purpose of updating website and for promotional publications  assists with the logistical coordination of accreditation site visits  maintains and arranges faculty and student identification scans for the department omni security system  serves as the department emergency contact  assists with the production ,  distribution ,  and display of materials required for accreditation ,  research presentations ,  and fashion shows  and performs other duties as assigned .       equivalent to two years  the ste2m center seeks an experienced and highly professional staff assistant to work as the primary support for the center .  this individual will primarily assist the center director with administrative tasks ,  support daily office - wide operations including financial record - keeping ,  and assist the director when needed .       1 .  provide basic analytical and specialized administrative support of a non - routine ,  non - repetitive nature to relieve and assist the director ,  including analyzing problems ,  determining approaches ,  compiling and analyzing data ,  and preparing reports / recommendations for action by the director .  2 .  plan or assist with ste2m center events .  manage calendars ,  schedule and coordinate meetings ,  including the creation and dissemination of flyers and / or notices ,  prepare agendas ,  make room and catering arrangements ,  and assure appropriate technology is in place and functioning .  3 .  arrange travel including schedule hotel ,  auto and airfare reservations ,  and produce travel authorization and reimbursement forms through the usu banner system .  4 .  compose ,  prepare ,  edit and proofread complex documents ,  reports ,  and other correspondence .  gather ,  assemble ,  and analyze information and data from a wide variety of sources .  work with university webmaster to update and maintain websites for the ste2m center .  5 .  coordinate and facilitate communications related to special projects and programs that may include student ,  faculty ,  and broad campus unit involvement .  answer telephone calls and tactfully handle inquiries and / or refer to appropriate party .  review and answer mail and inquiries on own initiative and determine within established guidelines if executive action is required .  6 .  serve as administrative support to center collaborations to develop grant proposals ,  follow up on pending details ,  coordinate project team activities ,  and ensure deadlines are met .  7 .  manage office inventory of supplies and equipment  general office duties  general financial responsibilities  ( record - keeping  expense tracking  p - cards )   and general assistance to other staff assistants .       1 .  four years of office - related experience  or an associate s degree plus two years of experience  or a bachelor s degree  or a certificate of completion of business administrative support program plus two years of experience .  2 .  ability to work effectively in a fast - paced ,  demanding office .  3 .  strong computer skills ,  including experience with microsoft office ,  and experience with or willingness to learn basic webpage skills and page layout or design programs .  4 .  ability to manage multiple tasks in a timely and effective manner .  5 .  ability to work independently with limited supervision .  6 .  effective organization ,  communication and problem - solving skills .  7 .  ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality ,  sensitivity and discretion .  8 .  ability to effectively interact with office personnel to meet deadlines and prioritize workload appropriately .  9 .  good understanding of the english language ,  including spelling ,  grammar and letter writing  and excellent proofreading skills .  10 .  ability to communicate in a professional manner with the university community ,  senior members of administration ,  and university guests .  11 .  cultural sensitivity in interacting with all guests ,  dignitaries and faculty .  12 .  excellent interpersonal skills .  13 .  detail oriented .  14 .  ability to maintain a positive ,  task - oriented ,  and focused attitude while at work .       1 .  advanced skills using microsoft excel 2 .  knowledge of usu s banner ,  canvas and ezbuy systems 3 .  familiar with usu policies and procedures     
 job description research assistant s&p ratings services 55 water street ,  new york the research assistant will collect ,  enter and verify various corporate or technical data  maintain data integrity with the s&p ratings services core / rpm and other databases ,  for the purpose of debt rating activities .  verifies and certifies data accuracy for publication purposes ,  such as daily press releases .  responsibilities  with minimum supervision ,  following established procedures ,  the research assistant performs the following duties ,  as needed  performs entry of data into systems ,  such as core ,  and maintains system log files to ensure accurate records of data entry into systems .  validates ratings information prior to rating release responds to inquiries regarding analytical and publishing matters requiring research  ( both company and outside inquiries )  .  this includes historical data ,  ratings confirmation ,  etc .  produces various reports  ( ad hoc requests ,  billing requests ,  etc )  in support of the business .  assists in the training of staff regarding core process and procedures .  collects key corporate and technical data ,  utilizing various systems  ( edgar ,  bloomberg ,  sdc )  for ratings research .  performs user acceptance testing ,  when necessary .  will work with it staff to help develop future processes and automation .  qualifications required  knowledge of ratings methodology and financial terms proficiency with working with relational databases ,  including reporting proficient in microsoft excel  knowledge of word ,  powerpoint and access a plus effective and proactive written and verbal communication skills the ability to be detail oriented the ability to work effectively in a team - oriented environment the ability to organize ,  meet deadlines and multitask provide other basic ad hoc data requests for management or the business units minimum of a bachelor s degree ,  preferably in accounting ,  finance ,  economics or mathematics minimum of 1 - 2 years work experience in related fields about standard & poor s ratings services and mcgraw hill financial be part of a $3 . 5 trillion team at standard & poor’s ratings services .  we’re looking for world - class thinkers to add to our team at standard & poor’s ratings services ,  the world’s leading provider of credit risk research ,  ratings and benchmarks .  at standard & poor’s ratings services ,  your opinion truly means everything .  we rate $3 . 5 trillion in new debt annually and investors rely on our independent ,  informed opinions on credit risk .  each person who works here has an essential role in standard & poor’s ratings services reputation of integrity ,  transparency ,  and ratings excellence .  with offices in 23 countries ,  standard & poor’s ratings services is an important part of the world s financial infrastructure and has played a leading role for 150 years in providing investors with information and independent benchmarks for their investment and financial decisions .  mcgraw hill financial includes standard & poor’s ratings services ,  s&p capital iq ,  s&p dow jones indices ,  j . d .  power ,  platts ,  and mcgraw hill construction .  together ,  we’re the foremost providers of essential intelligence for the capital and commodities markets .  learn more at www . mhfi . com / careers mcgraw hill financial is an equal opportunity employer .  only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment .  for special accommodation due to disability ,  please email webmaster  - at -  mcgraw - hill . com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate individual .

related graphics .   4 .  responds to internal customer inquiries ,  requests ,  and concerns relating to the internal and external websites and assists in graphic design and video development needs ,  as well as in disseminating a wide variety of information through the web .   minimum qualifications  a typical way of obtaining the knowledge ,  skills and abilities outlined above is graduation from a college or university with a major in web design ,  web development ,  marketing ,  public relations ,  communications or a closely related field  and at least one year of experience developing and supporting web content and graphic design .   licenses  certificates  special requirements  a valid class c california driver s license and the ability to maintain insurability under the authority s vehicle insurance program .   supplemental information  knowledge of   1 .  current and emerging internet / intranet technologies and associated products ,  tools and equipment .  2 .  principles ,  methods and techniques in website architecture and design .  3 .  computer generated graphics ,  image editing ,  publishing / printing and preflight .  4 .  graphic design techniques and industry standard applications .  5 .  web site usability and functionality ,  e . g .  navigational aids ,  knowledge management and information rendering .  6 .  methods and techniques for preparation of systems and customer documentation .  7 .  experience in html .  8 .  video development and editing skills .   ability to  1 .  design and update graphics for the authority s websites .  2 .  conceptualize and lead development of practical web - based solutions to meet departmental and customer requirements .  3 .  provide statistical reports on website usage and trends  recommend avenues for improvement and methods for implementation .  4 .  coordinate work effectively with other departments responsible for website content and presentation .  5 .  establish / maintain effective customer - focused relationships and communications with managers ,  departmental customers ,  employees ,  vendors ,  consultants and others encountered in the course of work .  6 .  communicate clearly and effectively ,  orally and in writing .  7 .  plan and conduct effective customer training when needed .  8 .  make sound ,  independent judgments within established guidelines .  9 .  prepare clear ,  concise and accurate systems documentation and reports of work performed .  10 .  troubleshoot and resolve website applications and network problems .  11 .  plan and complete projects efficiently and in accordance with authority quality standards .  12 .  perform business process analysis and reach sound ,  logical conclusions regarding customer needs and business requirements .  13 .  understand and apply the analysis of functional requirements to the development of systems proposals ,  specifications and recommendations for efficient ,  cost effective web technology solutions .

descriptioninstructional support assistant  ( job id 3449 ) full - time family consumer sciencesabout the division the department of family & consumer sciences is inspired by the belief that a supportive ,  challenging learning environment is a foundation for the personal ,  intellectual and professional development of our students ,  faculty and staff .  family & consumer sciences  ( fcs )  encompasses the study of relationships among people and their personal environments ,  focusing on the impact of physical ,  biological ,  and social environments on human behavior and development . design and apparel laboratories and the interior design resource library  secures and maintains instructional and research needs / materials  provides maintenance and general repair of equipment assists with general fcs web maintenance  serves as department photographer at fcs events for the purpose of updating website and for promotional publications  assists with the logistical coordination of accreditation site visits  maintains and arranges faculty and student identification scans for the department omni security system  serves as the department emergency contact  assists with the  10090br advertised position title software engineer intern  ( spring / summer 2014 )  division information systems work location va ,  herndon job description the itt exelis air traffic management  ( atm )  group is a recognized ,  vibrant ,  and growing organization providing unsurpassed engineering ,  management ,  operations ,  implementation ,  and information solutions for the federal aviation administration  ( faa )  .  we are in the forefront of the faa  s nextgen airspace modernization programs ,  helping the faa to achieve its technological transformation objectives .  this work includes modernizing from a ground - based system of air traffic control to a satellite - based system of air traffic management ,  improving communications between pilots and air traffic controllers enabling more efficient operations and reducing communications errors and radio congestion ,  and developing leading - edge concepts in all dimensions of air traffic control .  exelis atm is seeking software engineer summer 2014 interns to design and develop air traffic management systems for government and commercial customers .  our exciting and technically challenging projects include aircraft surveillance ,  air traffic control ,  and airport surface management systems for us and international air traffic control ,  airlines ,  and airports .  we offer opportunities to expand into systems engineering ,  proposal development ,  and management positions .  required experience    student must be entering their junior ,  senior year or a master s program   3 . 0 gpa or above   experience developing software in java ,  javascript ,  c c# ,  oracle or other databases .    coursework in one of the following areas   ( computer science ,  math ,  computer engineering ,  or electrical engineering   us citizenship is required desired skills    experience in javascript ,  c ,  sql ,  web services ,  gis ,  ui design ,  and mobile development preferred .    experience in designing systems from software requirements .    experience in airspace and orbital geometry   experience in systems engineering and other engineering disciplines ,  such as requirements analysis ,  test design and execution ,  systems configuration ,  integration and deployment .  clearance level required at start date sf85p percent of travel required n / a work status intern / co - op     
 the itt exelis air traffic management  ( atm )  group is a recognized ,  vibrant ,  and growing organization providing unsurpassed engineering ,  management ,  operations ,  implementation ,  and information solutions for the federal aviation administration  ( faa )  .  we are in the forefront of the faa s nextgen airspace modernization programs ,  helping the faa to achieve its technological transformation objectives .  this work includes modernizing from a ground - based system of air traffic control to a satellite - based system of air traffic management ,  improving communications between pilots and air traffic controllers enabling more efficient operations and reducing communications errors and radio congestion ,  and developing leading - edge concepts in all dimensions of air traffic control .   exelis atm is seeking software engineer summer 2014 interns to design and develop air traffic management systems for government and commercial customers .  our exciting and technically challenging projects include aircraft surveillance ,  air traffic control ,  and airport surface management systems for us and international air traffic control ,  airlines ,  and airports .  we offer opportunities to expand into systems engineering ,  proposal development ,  and management positions .         experience in javascript ,  c ,  sql ,  web services ,  gis ,  ui design ,  and mobile development preferred .    experience in designing systems from software requirements .    experience in airspace and orbital geometry   experience in systems engineering and other engineering disciplines ,  such as requirements analysis ,  test design and execution ,  systems configuration ,  integration and deployment .

time during their senior year and or receive a full - time offer to join kabam after graduation .  requirements  must be an undergraduate finishing your junior or in your senior year or enrolled in a graduate program major / concentration in user experience design ,  interaction design ,  human computer interface ,  human factors or related field ability to solve complex ui design challenges as part of a multi -  title  ux engineer  ( jr )   -  us citizenship required  -  columbia ,  md location  usa - md  maryland - columbia job number  1300kq7 we are seeking a passionate user interface designer to join our growing ,  unique ,  user - centric development environment .  our ui designers create user interfaces that take advantage of the newest technologies as well as mobile devices and tablets .  if you desire fascinating work ,  seek to tackle the hardest of visual communication challenges ,  and are truly driven ,  we challenge you to apply .  here are some examples of our projects    big ,  data - analytical platforms that combine petabytes of data with advanced analytics .  our analytics range from advanced graph theory ,  predictive analysis ,  latent semantic index ,  to trend analysis and more .  we’re limited only by our ideas and understanding of how data can be combined to paint a picture of our world .  we then combine this advanced data - processing system with an insightful and intuitive user experience to deliver a full solution to our customer .    data - collection platforms that understand users’ work flows for specific activities and gather data throughout the work flow .  this technique ,  when combined with real - time alerting ,  enhances the user’s ability to make accurate and timely decisions .  as always ,  we give equal attention to the user experience to develop a complete system .    multi - player gaming systems used to train both tactical skill sets and strategic decision - making .  we combine some of the most advanced simulation engines in the industry with our applications and our understanding of the customer environment to build the most relevant training systems possible .  essential job functions   assists in the development of and conducts website usability test plans .  conducts tests ,  analyzes data ,  and writes reports .    recruits and screens usability test participants and maintains contact databases .    develops ,  prioritizes ,  and promotes design recommendations based on usability principles ,  testing ,  research ,  best practices ,  and other data .    conducts site visits ,  contextual inquiries ,  focus groups ,  and other research to identify ,  understand ,  and prioritize user needs and workflows .    assists with the test design throughout the developmental process .  qualifications  basic qualifications   bachelor  s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience   bachelor  s degree in human factors ,  interface design ,  or related field preferred   two or more years of usability experience   experience working with design / information architecture and test background   experience working with current usability research ,  theories ,  and methodologies   experience working with html and graphic design tools other qualifications   communication skills   organizational skills   analytical and problem solving skills   ability to pay close attention to detail   ability to work independently and as part of a team   ability to facilitate change   ability to teach ,  lead ,  and guide others welcomed skills    we prefer an associates or bachelor’s degree in ui design or web site design ,  but we understand that sometimes experience is the best teacher .    requires an active security clearance and / or the ability to attain a clearance .    fluent in html 4 and css .    fluent in adobe creative suite 5 .    ability to work on multiple tasks simultaneously and a desire to stay ahead - of - the - curve by learning new emerging technologies .    knowledge of javascript   knowledge of 508 compliance   knowledge of building apps and websites for mobile devices job  internet / interface     
 intern  -  applications engineer opportunities at vmware  as an intern at vmware ,  you will be challenged to create innovative solutions for our customers by solving complex problems in a team - focused environment .  if you are driven to imagine ,  define and deliver what’s next for the industry and your career while unlocking your full potential ,  come to vmware .  you will have the opportunity to grow in our flexible and dynamic environment ,  challenge your thinking ,  and influence the future of technology .  connect with us to learn how you can be a part of what’s next .   applications  ( both front end and back end )   engineers interested in algorithms ,  building distributed applications ,  apis and fault - tolerant computing use virtualization as a key technology to design and implement applications that solve real - world problems .  they work on developing scalable software capable of managing thousands of systems .  applications engineers work on distributed systems ,  user interface ,  performance engineering ,  sdk ,  security and dynamic applications .   in our applications group ,  you may have to opportunity to work first - hand within these areas   distributed systems applications engineers interested in algorithms ,  building distributed applications ,  apis and fault - tolerant computing use virtualization as a key technology to design and implement applications that solve real - world problems .   user interface engineers interested in ui design ,  human - computer interaction ,  distributed computing and web technology get to design and implement windows ,  linux ,  and web - based uis for using and managing real and virtual machines .  they also assist in designing and implementing windows ,  linux ,  and web - based uis .   performance engineering engineers interested in understanding the behavior of complex software ,  optimizing performance and characterizing applications get to analyze and improve the performance of key components of virtualization software for industry - standard computer systems .  engineers interested in performance management and diagnostic tools get to design and develop products to help customers manage the performance of their applications running in virtual machines .   sdks engineers interested in performance management and diagnostic tools get to design and develop products to help customers manage the performance of their applications running in virtual machines .   security engineers interested in computer security ,  intrusion detection systems ,  and encryption algorithms get to research and develop applications of virtual machine technology for computer security .   requirements   -  pursuing bachelors ,  masters degree or phd in computer science or equivalent  -  all intern candidates must be enrolled at an accredited four year university with plans to return to school upon completion of an internship opportunity  -  technically skilled in java ,  j2ee ,  javascript or c ,  c#  ,  c++  -  experience with object oriented programming in a multithreaded environment  -  experience developing in linux or windows  ( both desirable )   -  experience with firewalls ,  intrusion detection ,  or encryptions  vmware is continually hiring for applications engineer opportunities .   vmw2 location palo alto ,  ca ,  us is this a remote or multiple location position ?  no requisition number 45285br eeo statement vmware is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees .  equal opportunity and consideration are afforded to all qualified applicants and employees in personnel actions ,  which include  recruiting and hiring ,  selection for training ,  promotion ,  rates of pay or other compensation ,  transfer ,  discipline ,  demotion ,  layoff or termination .  vmware does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race ,  color ,  religion ,  sexual orientation ,  marital status ,  pregnancy ,  gender identity ,  gender expression ,  family medical history or genetic information ,  citizenship ,  national origin or ancestry ,  sex ,  age ,  physical or mental disability ,  medical condition ,  veteran status ,  military status ,  or any other basis protected by federal ,  state or local law ,  ordinance or regulation .  vmware also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law .  further ,  it is the policy of vmware to maintain a working environment free of all forms of harassment .  note to applicant  please disable your pop -  disney professional internships  copywriter / concept internship  -  yellow shoes  company overview  since its opening in 1955 ,  the disneyland resort in anaheim ,  california has welcomed guests of all ages from around the globe .  the disneyland resort features two spectacular theme parks – disneyland  ( the original disney theme park )  and disney california adventure park – plus the downtown disney district comprised of unique dining ,  entertainment and shopping experiences .  the resort’s three hotels are the luxurious disney’s grand californian hotel & spa  the magical disneyland hotel and disney’s paradise pier hotel with its   day - at - the - beach   fun .   department overview  do you live for the big idea ?  are you endlessly curious ?  do you love to write ?  do you get excited about consumer insights and human truths ?  if so ,  we’d love to hear from you !  we’re disney yellow shoes ,  the award - winning ,  in - house creative group for disney theme parks and resorts .  every day ,  we have the good fortune to create compelling ,  memorable work for one of the greatest brands on the planet ,  and we’re looking for one very special ,  talented copywriter / concept intern to join us at our glendale ,  ca location .    as a copywriter / concept intern ,  you’ll get the chance to stretch your creative muscles on one of the greatest brands on the planet .  you’ll work closely with senior creative leadership and get the opportunity to strut your stuff on a broad range of mediums  broadcast ,  print ,  digital ,  out - of - home collateral and direct .   some of the things you’ll be doing ,  but not limited to will include     as a member of the yellow shoes creative team ,  you’ll create concepts for disney theme parks & resorts ,  disney cruise line ,  aulani and adventures by disney .     write for a wide variety of mediums – print ,  broadcast ,  digital ,  out - of - home ,  collateral and direct .     participate in ideation and strategy sessions along with senior creative leadership .     creative research – you’ll identify and share the latest trends in music ,  photography ,  illustration and new media .     assist in developing materials for creative / strategic presentations .    these are the minimum qualifications you need to be considered for this position     currently enrolled as a junior ,  senior in a college / university working towards a bachelor’s degree advertising ,  design ,  english or a related field or have graduated within 6 months of the start date of the internship    proficiency in microsoft word    demonstrated problem solving and decision making skills    demonstrated strong organizational and time management skills    capable of thriving in a fast -  who we are  baublebar is building a unique retail destination for jewelry by addressing the unmet needs of both consumers and designers .  since launching in january 2011 ,  baublebar has resonated with consumers and tastemakers alike ,  having been picked up by a wide range of outlets from editorial wwd and vogue to popular us weekly and the today show to celebrities like rihanna and gwyneth paltrow .  we love color - blocking ,  tequila and the occasional afternoon dance party .  what we’re looking for  ideal candidates are entrepreneurially - minded self - starters with an editorial background and a demonstrated passion for the written words .  the baublebar team is comprised of individuals who thrive on finding intriguing solutions to ambiguous problems ,  possess the desire to dive in and learn in a fast - paced environment ,  and are considerate of one another .  interested candidates should work well in a flat organization ,  and excel at communicating with individuals across a diverse range of disciplines .  you should also love frozen yogurt – we eat a lot of it .  what we want you to do  manage written content across both digital and print assets .  responsible     
 regardless of college major or professional experience ,  nearly 100% of our full - time employees start out in our management training program .  this allows everyone to learn our business from the ground up and understand how they play a significant role in seeing it succeed .   once you ve completed your initial orientation and training ,  you ll be assigned to a branch office in your home area and the hands - on training begins .  you ll learn valuable business skills from capable mentors who were once in your shoes .  nearly 100% of all our managers and corporate executives started out as management trainees .   during your first year ,  you will actively participate in everything from sales and marketing and customer service to operations and finance .  as you progress ,  you will be tested and evaluated to determine your proficiency in these areas .  successful completion of these tests and evaluations will result in rewards ,  pay increases and the opportunity for continued promotions .   as you progress ,  increasingly more opportunities will become available to you .  you can choose ,  as most people do ,  to continue your rewarding ascent within our rental operations managerial track or you can explore one of many other exciting options including fleet management ,   human resources ,  car sales ,  accounting ,  marketing and more .    as a management trainee ,  you are empowered to make business decisions that greatly affect your career as well as the bottom line .  you ll gain responsibility for developing new business and maintaining current relationships .  you ll be responsible for understanding cost control ,  reading your branch s p&l statement and understanding what it takes to run a profitable business .  you will also learn how to deliver superior customer service .  we will teach you how to effectively communicate ,  influence and interact with all types of customers ,  vendors and co - workers .  you ll learn proper sales techniques to problem solving and conflict management .  those skills will provide you with the opportunity to market to local business partners and build solid ,  long - lasting relationships with key business decision - makers .  in your development to become a successful manager at enterprise ,  you ll learn how to mentor ,  train ,  develop ,  manage and promote a staff of your own .      associates degree required ,  bachelors degree preferred   minimum 6 months of experience in sales and customer service  ( with set goals or bonus potential )  or  ( in a retail ,  call center or restaurant environment )    will consider 1 year of leadership experience in organizations / clubs ,  military ,  volunteerism ,  community service or in an organized athletic environment ,  in lieu of work experience .     must have a valid driver s license in with no more than 2 moving violations and / or at - fault accidents on driving record in the past 3 years .    no drug or alcohol - related conviction on driving record in the past 3 years  ( dui / dwi )  .    must be at least 18 years old .    must be authorized to work in the united states and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future .    must be available to work at our killeen ,  tx and temple ,  tx offices  ( if not currently living in the area must be relocating within 30 days )    must be available to work an average of 48 hours per week .    must be willing to accept first year compensation between $34 , 000 and $36 , 000

 all employees are expected to perform their duties in alignment with the vision and values of the organization .  the person doing this job is responsible for a variety of tasks that lead to a high level of customer satisfaction in the most cost effective manner .  under the supervision of a case manager ,  this role works with the patient / family ,  multidisciplinary team and physicians ,  to optimize the process of patient s progress through the continuum of care  -  intervening and executing the discharge plan .  works in a collegial manner with physicians and other consultants to implement individualized discharge plans .  proactive in assuring the delivery of appropriate ,  effective ,  quality ,  safe discharge in a cost effective manner .  maintains availability as a resource to facilitate communication among providers and patient / family to remain involved in the discharge plan .  facilitates system / process improvements to reduce / remove barriers to discharge .  fully participates and promotes focused programs / projects of the care coordination department .  incorporates into daily activity ,  education of the multidisciplinary team regarding the case management program functions ,  goals ,  and outcomes .   qualifications   requires a minimum of one year of experience as a discharge planner or case manager assistant .   computer skills required .  high school diploma required .  knowledge of insurance coverage and / or discharge planning processes required .   requires knowledge of microsoft office word processing and other software .   excellent interpersonal communication ,  negotiation and conflict management skills  ( customer service focus )  .  current working knowledge of reimbursement  ( drg ,  medicare ,  medi - cal ,  managed care )  .  flexible ,  open - minded and adaptable to change .  strong organizational and time management skills ,  as evidenced by capacity to prioritize multiple tasks and role components .  ability to work independently and exercise and sound judgment in interactions with physicians ,  payers ,  and patients / families .  understanding of continuum of care ,  including pre - acute and post - acute venues of care and community resources .  able to work with people of all social ,  economics ,  and cultural backgrounds .  ability to make routine decisions that usually have a limited number of solutions .  ability to exercise judgment in selection of the order of work assignments to meet clearly established schedules .  unusual cases or schedule changes are often referred to the immediate supervisor for resolution .   about us  we re california hospital medical center  ( chmc )  ,  a not - for - profit ,  319 - bed acute and ambulatory care hospital that provides services to the dynamic community of downtown los angeles and its surrounding neighborhoods .  with a 120 - year history of healing ,  our vision is a growing and diversified health care ministry distinguished by excellent quality and committed to expanding access to those in need .   the hospital is part of dignity health ,  one of the largest healthcare systems in the west with 40+ hospitals in arizona ,  california and nevada .  our mission ,  vision and values were all formed out of the recognition of the inherent dignity of each person .  it also represents our commitment to delivering excellent medical care to all ,  to advocating on behalf of the poor ,  and to partnering with others to improve the quality of life .   our outstanding benefits package includes 100% employer paid medical benefits for you and your family ,  including domestic partners .  also included are a 403  ( b )  plan with company match ,  tuition reimbursement and comprehensive dental and vision plans .   .   located blocks from staples center and la live ,  california hospital is walking distance from the metro blue line and employee parking is complimentary .  the hospital also sponsors shuttle service to and from union station .  to find out more ,  go to www . chmcla . org .  eoe .   organization   california hospital med center  primary location   california -
